Title: The Cage is HIRING!!!
Creator: Jankhna Sura <jankhna.sura@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
üì£ We‚Äôre hiring! üì£

The RTVF Equipment Resource Center, ‚ÄúThe Cage,‚Äù is hiring student workers for Spring 2026 (and beyond). The Cage circulates equipment for approximately 300 faculty, staff, and students in the department. Job duties include, but aren‚Äôt limited to, preparing reservations, checking orders out, returning items, and inventory. Ideal characteristic traits are attention to detail, good customer service, good communication skills, reliable nature, fast learner and worker, and good work ethic. Position does require bending, lifting, carrying, and moving around a good amount of weight repeatedly during a shift. Position is open to both work study and non-work [...]

Title: Course Project Team designing solutions for RTVF students
Creator: Ian Lundeen <ianlundeen2026@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hello everyone,

We‚Äôre part of a student group working on a tech-enabled solution aimed at
supporting RTVF students and others working on film sets.

Our goal is to better understand the pain points you encounter during your
projects. Whether that‚Äôs sourcing props, film financing, on-set logistics,
or anything else that makes production harder than it needs to be. Your
feedback will directly inform and guide what we build. [...]

Title: SEEKING DANCERS AND CREW FOR GRADUATION: a Visual-First Fashion Short Film
Creator: Kaia Chen <kaiachen2027@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Seeking DANCERS and CREW FOR:

Graduation

[image: image.png]

An ATP Senior Production

Directed by Elias Fan

Produced by Kaia Chen

Graduation is a visual-first fashion film that reimagines the college
experience through surreal and symbolic storytelling. By deconstructing
recognizable academic aesthetics and reframing them through a liminal
visual language, the film traces an externalized internal journey marked by
self-transgression, hysteria, and collective reverence. References to
religious iconography introduce a quiet cult-like texture, amplifying the
work‚Äôs emotional and psychological depth. Original music and choreography
further shape an immersive experience of reflection, transformation and
closure. [...]

informative! Think *Last Week Tonight*. We also produce shorter, quarterly
satirical pieces from a contrasting perspective. Think the *Colbert
Report *(rip).

Title: Black Screens has TWO events this Sunday 11/16 and Monday 11/17!
Creator: Mary Belay <marybelay2026@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi RTVF friends!

*Black Screens is hosting two events this upcoming Sunday 11/16 and Monday
11/17!!*

This Monday, Black Screens is delighted to have Loyola Mount University
Professor and Graduate Program MFA Director, *Weiko Lin*, for a discussion
on "Writing the Emotions You Know" in the Multicultural Center at 3 pm.

Following the conversation, we will have a presentation on LMU's MFA in
Screenwriting, Writing and Producing for TV, Production, and Master's in
Entertainment Leadership and Management Program. Recently, LMU alumni wrote
Netflix's K-POP DEMON HUNTERS and served as a cinematographer for SINNERS.
Some notable LMU alums include Oscar winner [...]

Title: FALSE FROM TRUE PROSHOT ASK
Creator: Jonah Mensch <jonahmensch2027@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hello film friends!

My name is Jonah Mensch, and I am the writer and co-director of False From
True, an original musical using original arrangements of songs made famous
by Pete Seeger to tell a story of honesty in the political realm and beyond.

Our show is going up in Shanley Pavilion on Thursday November 20th and
Friday November 21st at 7pm and 10pm both nights. As this is a world
premiere of a new work, we would love to document it in video. Thats why I
need YOU! [...]

In this bold reimagining of Ibsen‚Äôs classic, newlywed Hedda (Tessa
Thompson) masks her inner turmoil beneath a veneer of control‚Äîuntil the
return of her former love, the magnetic Eileen Lovberg (Nina Hoss), ignites
a night of chaos and desire. Written and directed by Nia DaCosta, HEDDA is
a daring exploration of freedom, control, and the cost of defiance. [...]

Title: Documentary Film Screening July 12 - Saving Mes Aynak
Creator: Haoshu Sascha Deng <hsdeng@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hello RTVF,

Around this summer in Chicago? South Asia Institute is screening the
award-winning documentary film *Saving Mes Aynak *on July 12!

[image: SMA_PosterUpdate_27x40.Web.jpg]

Saving Mes Aynak: Film Screening
<https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://www.saichicago.org/calendar/saving-mes-aynak__;!!Dq0X2DkFhyF93HkjWTBQKhk!TUvTj88RMF3MjKRC_4axSdjNhaWik4URp2fWU3Mvowhg-SfBS3b6EuokcPjm3CMOujOSagUbvAMvx0000nEEYKUVaoPrbisAcHtJ$ >
Saturday, July 12, 2025
2-4PM
South Asia Institute
1925 S Michigan Ave, Chicago, IL

*Saving Mes Aynak* is an award-winning documentary film following Afghan
archaeologist Qadir Temori as he races against time to save a
5,000-year-old archaeological site in Afghanistan from imminent demolition.
The film is directed and produced by *Medill professor Brent E. Hoffman*.
Since the film's release in 2014, much effort has been done to continue
preserving [...]

Title: Recruiting for Marketing & Outreach Collaborators For An Event Ticketing Platform
Creator: Andrew Pulver <andrewpulver2024@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hello!

I'm Andrew, a very recent (December) NU grad.

I'm looking for marketing & outreach collaborators this summer for my
company Ticketbarber.com, the event ticketing platform to grow revenues &
community.

We help event organizers with the hardest part of organizing an event
(getting people to come to the event!) by providing event affiliate links.
This allows event organizers to partner with influencers and publications
to market their event and more easily sell out while giving influencers an
authentic monetization strategy. [...]

Title: SEEKING HMU ARTIST AND POST-PROD FOR "TIE"
Creator: Lily Kim <liki@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
SEEKING ADDITIONAL CREW FOR

‚ÄúTie‚Äù

A MultiCulti Film

Shooting Spring Weekend 2 (April 11 - April 13)

Written & Directed by Ariel Paul

Produced by Lily Kim

LOGLINE:

On his way to his older brother's wedding, Ant has to navigate the
complexities of identity, family, acceptance, and the most challenging task

Title: Makeup Design Class in Spring
Creator: Mark Park <markpark@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi RTVF!

Sending this because there's a few spots still left in the makeup design
course in case anyone is interested.

*CMN 396: The Art of Makeup Design*

Thursdays, 12:00pm - 2:50pm

This course explores the art and process of makeup design, focusing on
creating visual storytelling through research, design development, and
rendering. Students will learn how to conceptualize and design makeup looks
for various mediums, including theatre, film, and photoshoots, while
gaining insights into the collaborative nature of the design process. The
class is structured to be accessible for all levels, with no requirement
for makeup application or product [...]

Title: Breaking Into The Industry - Networking Event
Creator: Industry Co-Chairs <studio22.industry@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Hello Fellow Entertainment Industry Folks!

With RTVF Formal now postponed to April 3, we wanted to offer you
another networking
opportunity in return. Let‚Äôs call this a late Thanksgiving Thursday‚Äîour way
of thanking you for your support, understanding, and the hard work you put
into working on sets every weekend.

[image: MultiCulti - Armenians in Chicago.png]

Filming Week 4 of Spring Quarter

Main Premise: Documentation and exploration of the Armenian identity
through the lens of the Armenian Diaspora in Chicago.

interviewing (NU students and beyond) and filming two dance scenes in
studio spaces. [...]

Seeking Additional Crew for:

A MAG Film

Written and Directed by Satarie Bennett

Shooting weekend 1 and 3 of Spring Quarter

(April 4-6 and April 18-20)

Logline: On her 19th birthday, a heartbroken teenage girl revisits the

*What is it?*

The Agnes Nixon Playwriting Festival is a spring quarter class focused on

Description:
*END OF JULY*

A Senior Directing Film

Written and Directed by *Lia Chang*

Produced by *Sabrina Schmitt* and *Hunter Bachrach*

*Shooting Weekend 4 (Jan. 31st - Feb. 2nd)*

*URGENTLY SEEKING A GAFFER*

*Logline: *

High school seniors Sienna, an insecure Korean girl, and July, her
seemingly perfect best friend, navigate a fragile friendship strained by
jealousy and toxic behavior. When a strange dream prompts Sienna to
confront her deep-seated fears, her inability to be honest threatens to
unravel their bond, despite their mutual affection. [...]

you already has it. [...]

A search for a brighter light leads to a stranger in the dark.

‚ÄúOther Light‚Äù is a metaphorical portrayal of how it feels to inexplicably
lose your sense of happiness, seek unadvisable comfort in equally-miserable
company, and find yourself again at the end of it all. The story emphasizes
the normality of searching for happiness and feeling like everyone around
you already has it. [...]

Title: Re: Multiculti Speaker Event 11/6 @ 6:30pm
Creator: Multi Culti <nu.multiculti@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Hello RTVF,

Here is some more context about the film and our speakers. Would love to
see you guys there!

Desde Cero: The Migrant Journey of Chicago is a one-hour, bilingual
documentary by NBC 5 Chicago and Telemundo Chicago. Reporters Sandra Torres and
Ivon Espitia with Senior Digital Video Producer DS Shin capture the
experiences and perspectives of migrant families and individuals on their
journeys to the United States and Chicago over the span of six months. The
documentary works to humanize the migrant crisis in Chicago beyond
headlines and amplify the voices of those most affected. [...]

Title: [ANNOUNCING] AUDITION FOR GRIFFIN'S TALE!
Creator: Cassius Cole <CassiusCole2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
*AUDITION FOR GRIFFIN'S TALE!*
[image: Audition for Griffin's Tale!.png]
*Do you LOVE to have fun?*
*Do you LOVE to play pretend?*
*Does the idea of bringing joy to hundreds of children make you giddy??*
AUDITION FOR GRIFFIN'S TALE!
We take stories from elementary schools across the Evanston/Chicagoland
area and adapt them into skits, songs, poems, raps, dances, you name it!
Then every Friday in spring, we go to the elementary schools and perform
the kids stories for them! They absolutely love it and we absolutely love
doing it :D [...]

Title: Feature Film Seeking Background Actors
Creator: Georgia Bernstein <georgiaberns@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Hi RTVF,

Interested in being a background actor in a feature film? We would love to
cast you as a YOUNG NURSE in our film!

*SEEKING* - Young Women (20 - 40 years old)

*SYNOPSIS FOR NIGHT NURSE
<https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://deadline.com/2024/07/night-nurse-mimi-rogers-cemre-paksoy-to-star-erotic-thriller-1236011898/__;!!Dq0X2DkFhyF93HkjWTBQKhk!U6hfIr58EWbAk_MZbbfHiTSzEz4bDjUb0qoiFtUDzrCxI9SQWDyXfd2fDaHdN52tPWHaI2hLb25kKpJ7r35f6RQKxHV-UZwK8lg$ >*
- The film takes place behind the gates of a remote retirement community
where a starry-eyed nurse is beguiled by a string of perverse scam calls.
When she discovers her patient is the seductive con man behind these
schemes, her innocent flirtation blooms into a lust for deception. [...]

Title: REINTRODUCING URSA FOR THE 2024-2025 SCHOOL YEAR
Creator: URSA <ursa@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hello RTVF Community And Welcome To All New Subscribers!

This is the Undergraduate Radio/Television/Film Student Association (URSA)!

If you are unfamiliar with URSA, we are a group of student representatives
in the RTVF department to act as a liaison between the student body and the
faculty. Our role is to relay students' questions, issues, concerns,
complaints, and ideas about the curriculum to the faculty so that these
problems can be solved. Our co-chairs attend monthly faculty meetings and
meet with the department chairs regularly in order to ensure that the
students are being heard and valued. Additionally, we are in [...]

Title: ANNOUNCING 24-25 EXEC PETITIONS FOR MULTI-CULTI
Creator: Multi Culti <nu.multiculti@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Hello!

The Multicultural Filmmakers Collective (MFC/MultiCulti) is holding
petitions this Saturday 5/11 and Monday *5/13 *for our 2024-2025 Executive
Board.

Who are we and what do we do?

Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is a student-run production company
that aims to provide an encouraging environment for the burgeoning
creativity of multicultural student filmmakers. The purpose of the
Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is to nurture, promote, and ally
multicultural student filmmakers at Northwestern University, as well as
support student films that present multicultural concerns and experiences.
We define multicultural as including, but not limited to, underrepresented
races, ethnicities, and religions. In addition to general [...]

Title: PRODUCER PETITIONS: "SOB STORY"
Creator: Cooper Silverman <coopersilverman2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Announcing Producer Petitions For ‚ÄúSob Story‚Äù

A Senior Directing Film

Shooting Winter Quarter Weekends TBD

Synopsis:

Clare Kramer is struggling to make ends meet and raise funds for her
father‚Äôs end of life care. She finds an unexpected life line when her actor
friend, Nick, has her fill in for him at his ‚Äòmourning for hire‚Äô service.
Clare is surprised to find that the work is enjoyable and extremely
lucrative. Her success in the new field is ultimately tested when she has
to mourn for real. Will she be able to feel? Or has pretending to feel
muted that possibility? [...]

Title: SEEKING VFX and FOLEY ARTIST - Pritzker Pucker Studio Lab film
Creator: Aisha Hamid <aishahamid2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
[image: image.png]

A Pritzker Pucker Short Film titled Ponytail, written and directed by Aisha
Hamid, an MFA Writing for the Screen and Stage grad

*'When a grieving daughter reconnects with her widowed father over
a ponytail, she discovers a life altering truth about him.'*

Ponytail is a quiet, intimate, domestic drama that attempts to capture the
isolation we feel in loss, in mental and physical illness, and the many
ways we show up for our family even when it is the hardest thing to do. [...]

WHITE NOISE is a short hybrid film that will be shot using REAL WORLD CINEMATOGRAPHY and VIRTUAL CINEMATOGRAPHY. I am seeking a CREW for the REAL LIFE SHOOT and would love to have you on board!

SYNOPSIS:
When introverted developer MAX is too shy to ask out his barista KAYLEIGH, he creates a VR version of her inside PHANTA, a VR sex app. But when the changes he makes to her avatar start to show up on Kayleigh in real life, he begins to believe that his actions in [...]

Title: Solar Eclipse Best Practices!
Creator: Shannon C Pritchard <shannon.pritchard@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
The cage wants you to...

Enjoy the eclipse! Just protect your eyes, phone, and cameras. Never, ever shoot a camera directly into the sun without a solar filter. The sun could potentially harm our camera's sensors without a solar filter. Thank you!

Rachael E. Moeller (she/her/hers)
Production Equipment Specialist
Northwestern University
1877 Campus Drive
Evanston, IL 60208
(847) 491-5226

Northwestern instead of
the-british-school-for-funny-boys-who-keep-stealing-Seth-Meyers's-Emmy-awards

about a year, but we're hoping to BRING IT BACK! [...]

Title: Student Organization for Black Students!!
Creator: Kiara Hill <kiarahill2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
[image: Interest in Black Screens.png]

Hello!

I hope you all had a great break and are excited to enter this new season
and quarter at Northwestern. To kick off the new quarter, Black Screens is
looking to revamp itself as a student organization!

If you are unfamiliar with Black Screens, it is more than just a club. It's
a community envisioned by Profs. Cornett and Petty, where black students in
RTVF and theater‚Äîand also in the greater NU community who are interested in
film‚Äîcan find support, build connections, and grow together. We believe in
the power of unity and the [...]

Title: Re: CASTING CALL: CAF√â CON LECHE
Creator: The Reminderer <efren.ponce2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Self-tapes are due this coming Wednesday!  Below is an updated casting call, along with the new film title:

ANNOUNCING: CASTING CALL FOR

A Studio 22 Film

Written by Efrén

Directed by Sophia Pedro Torres

Produced by Anna Castagnaro and Lily Kim

Logline: To maintain control of her identity, a Hispanic Latina fights her White counterpart. Literally.

Shooting Weekend 4 of Spring Quarter

April 19th - 21st

Rehearsals TBD

Seeking:

Ethnic/cultural identity is central in Café con leche; BIPOC students are strongly encouraged to audition.

*GUADA (female-identifying undergrad age, Hispanic): A “no sabo” kid who doesn't have tangible ways of expressing her Hispanic identity. She randomly has fighting skills à la Scott Pilgrim, so this role will involve combat training. Her Japanese is also not too shabby, so Japanese will also be in the mix (though proficiency in the language is not required). In collaboration with Efren, details in the script will be added according to the background of the actress who plays Guada.

*WANDA (female-identifying undergrad age, White): Guada's “White self” except she's not struggling with her identity. She shares the same physicality as Guada, but has her own cadence.

*LIZ (any gender, undergrad age, Hispanic): More connected to her ethnic cultural roots, in that her Spanish isn't broken. She's sympathetic to Guada's comparatively American identity.

*MR. PEÑA (male-identifying, middle age, Hispanic): Liz's dad, who means well, but has simplistic views on Guada's struggle with identity, and doesn't consider background. To him, she's Hispanic in name only.

*JOSÉ (male-identifying, undergrad age, White or white-passing Hispanic): Has worked to balance his European roots with his Hispanic ones, mastering the binary and willing to help Guada survive it as well.

MINOR CHARACTERS:

WASIAN GUY (any gender, undergrad age, East or South Asian-identifying): Role will involve combat.

WHITE GUY (will be matched with Wasian Guy): Role will involve combat.

WHITE UPSTANDER (any gender, spoken role, character side in folder)

BLACK GIRL 1 (any gender, undergrad age, spoken role, character side in folder): Role will involve combat.

BLACK GIRL 2 (will be matched with Black Girl 1): Role will involve combat.

*NOTES*

  1. If auditioning for Guada, submit for any of/all of those character sides.

  2. We will be auditioning for Wanda during callbacks after Spring break, but still encourage self-tapes for that particular character side!

Character sides and the latest script draft can be found here. Fill out this form to submit self-tapes.


 

Best,

CAFÉ CON LECHE Casting Team

Email us: Sophia Pedro Torres and Efren Ponce

Title: CASTING CALL: BROWN/WHITE
Creator: Man of Many Sombreros <efren.ponce2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
ANNOUNCING: CASTING CALL FOR

A Studio 22 Film

Written by Efren

Directed by Sophia Pedro Torres

Produced by Anna Castagnaro and Lily Kim

Logline: To maintain control of her identity, a Hispanic Latina fights her White counterpart. Literally.

Shooting Weekend 4 of Spring Quarter

April 19th - 21st

Rehearsals TBD

•

Seeking:

Ethnic/cultural identity is central in Brown/White; BIPOC students are strongly encouraged to audition.

*GUADA (female-identifying undergrad, Hispanic): A “no sabo” kid who doesn't have tangible ways of expressing her Hispanic identity. She randomly has fighting skills à la Scott Pilgrim, so this role will involve combat training. Her Japanese is also not too shabby, so Japanese will also be in the mix.

*WANDA (female-identifying undergrad, White): Guada's “White self” except she's not struggling with her identity. She shares the same physicality as Guada, but has her own cadence.

*LIZ (any gender, undergrad, Hispanic): More connected to her ethnic cultural roots, in that her Spanish isn't broken. She's sympathetic to Guada's comparatively American identity.

*MR. PEÑA (male-identifying, Hispanic): Liz's dad, who means well, but has simplistic views on Guada's struggle with identity, and doesn't consider background. To him, she's Hispanic in name only.

*JOSÉ (male-identifying, White or white-passing Hispanic): Has worked to balance his European roots with his Hispanic ones, mastering the binary and willing to help Guada survive it as well.

MINOR CHARACTERS:

WASIAN GUY (any gender, East or South Asian-identifying): Role will involve combat.

WHITE GUY (any gender, but will be matched with Wasian Guy): Role will involve combat.

WHITE UPSTANDER (any gender, spoken role, character side in folder)

BLACK GIRL (any gender, spoken role, character side in folder): Role will involve combat.

WHITE GIRL (any gender, but will be matched with Black Girl): Role will involve combat.

*NOTES*

*If auditioning for Guada, submit for any of/all of those character sides.*

*We will be auditioning for Wanda during callbacks after Spring break, but still encourage self-tapes for that particular character side!*

•

Character sides and the latest script draft can be found here. Fill out this form to submit self-tapes.


 

Best,

BROWN/WHITE Casting Team

Email us: Sophia Pedro Torres and Efren Ponce

Title: INTRODUCING: The MULTICULTI MENTORSHIP Program

Description:
INTRODUCING THE MULTICULTI MENTORSHIP PROGRAM

In a world where connecting with people is easier and yet harder than ever,
Multiculti provides an avenue to connect upperclassmen and underclassmen in
the RTVF department! But we also know that RTVF is a popular transfer
program, so this is also for all those RTVF newbies that want to learn more
about the student film landscape, to commiserate about the highs and lows
of being a film student, and to hang out when the edit is just not working.
Multiculti will also be hosting periodic events to facilitate mentor/mentee
bonding! [...]

Title: Seeking: paid assistant editor
Creator: Rebecca Shaid <rebeccashaid2024@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
*Beyond the Fantasy: *

‚ÄúBeyond the Fantasy‚Äù is an independent documentary film that explores an
artistic subculture of Chicago's stripper community. The film sheds light
on the artists at the forefront of this movement, and how their work has
cultivated a sense of community through sex-worker-managed events and
venues. At the heart of this film lies Siren Studio, a dynamic space that
serves as both Kat Savage's photography studio and Maddy Frechette's pole
studio. From photoshoots to pole classes to their monthly Siren Shows ‚Äî
curated strip shows hosted in venues around Chicago ‚Äî watch as these two
artists grow [...]

Description:
[image: image.png]

A Pritzker Pucker Short Film titled Ponytail, written and directed by Aisha
Hamid, an MFA Writing for the Screen and Stage grad

*'When a grieving daughter reconnects with her widowed father over a
ponytail, she discovers a life altering truth about him.'*

Ponytail is a quiet, intimate, domestic drama that attempts to capture the
isolation we feel in loss, in mental and physical illness, and the many
ways we show up for our family even when it is one of the most difficult
things to do. [...]

Title: The Cage Is Hiring!
Creator: Rachael Moeller <rachael@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description: The RTVF Equipment Resource Center, ‚ÄúThe Cage‚Äù, is hiring student workers for Spring 2024 (and beyond). The Cage circulates equipment for approximately 300 faculty, staff, and students in the department. Job duties include, but aren‚Äôt limited to, preparing reservations, checking orders out, returning items, and inventory. Ideal characteristic traits are attention to detail, good customer service, good communication skills, reliable nature, fast learner and worker, and good work ethic. Position does require bending, lifting, carrying, and moving around a good amount of weight repeatedly during a shift. Position is open to both work study and non-work study students. If you [...]

Title: Crew Call - Pritzker Pucker Studio Lab film
Creator: Aisha Hamid <aishahamid2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
[image: image.png]*

A Pritzker Pucker Short Film titled Ponytail, written and directed by Aisha
Hamid, an MFA Writing for the Screen and Stage grad

*'When a grieving daughter reconnects with her widowed father over a
ponytail, she discovers a life altering truth about him.'*

Ponytail is a quiet, intimate, domestic drama that attempts to capture the
isolation we feel in loss, in mental and physical illness, and the many
ways we show up for our family even when it is one of the most difficult
things to do. [...]

adulthood, each encounter serving as a catalyst for her metamorphosis into
a new, empowered self. [...]

Ôøº

Title: Northwestern Cinematheque is back!

hey RTVF!

Title: DEADLINE EXTENDED: LOOK, MA, I MADE IT!
Creator: Sophie Brown <sophiebrown2024@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
***DEADLINE EXTENSION ALERT!***

CASTING CALL FOR "LOOK, MA, I MADE IT!"

A Bindley Grant Film

Written/Directed by Mantra

Produced by Katherine Tuohy and Zack Owens

Shooting Winter Weeks 3 and 4 

Logline: Two aspiring female actors get trapped in a never-ending loop of commercials with no way out…except someone calling, ‘CUT!’ 

SEEKING ACTORS: 

LULU (Female-identifying, White): Naive, believes the best in people. Her smile could probably change the world.

BECKY (Female-identifying, BIPOC): A little cynical, but knows she's destined for greatness. She's a fighter.

HOW TO AUDITION: 

Please submit a self-tape using the provided sides, which can be found along with the full script in this folder. Self tapes are now due SUNDAY, JANUARY 7TH at 11:59pm to this form. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to sophiebrown2024@u.northwestern.edu. Thanks!

Title: Application-free screenwriting club :)
Creator: Yorgos Lanthimos' Beard <efren.ponce2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Join CoPilot (Or come back! Please!)

Wednesdays starting Jan 10 at 8p in Kresge 2335 and 2339

•

A low-stakes, application-free screenwriting club where folks conceive original TV shows. Not a writer? No worries!

•

This quarter, you can work in small groups. This way, we hope everyone will be comfortable voicing any opinions and contributing in a way that allows each show to head in the desired direction. We're also flexible with organizing ourselves according to what you all wanna do.

•

Shows created last quarter:

A mockumentary about zombies selling life insurance.

A dramedy about an astronautic B-Team (the A-Team all died).

•

Email us at copilot@u.northwestern.edu with questions and/or to join our Winter email list.

Follow us on Instagram: @copilot.nu

Title: CASTING CALL: "LOOK, MA, I MADE IT!"
Creator: Sophie Brown <sophiebrown2024@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
CASTING CALL FOR "LOOK, MA, I MADE IT!"

A Bindley Grant Film

Written/Directed by Mantra

Produced by Katherine Tuohy and Zack Owens

Shooting Winter Weeks 3 and 4

Logline: Two aspiring female actors get trapped in a never-ending loop of commercials with no way out…except someone calling, ‘CUT!’

SEEKING ACTORS:

LULU (Female-identifying, White): Naive, believes the best in people. Her smile could probably change the world.

BECKY (Female-identifying, BIPOC): A little cynical, but knows she's destined for greatness. She's a fighter.

HOW TO AUDITION:

Please submit a self-tape using the provided sides, which can be found along with the full script in this folder. Self tapes are due Friday, January 5th, to this form. Alternatively, we will also be having an open call on January 4th should that be preferred. Please sign up at this link and fill out this form as well before then. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to sophiebrown2024@u.northwestern.edu. Thanks!

Title: DEADLINE EXTENDED: Fall 2023 Max Saines Grant Director Pitches
Creator: Studio 22 Exec <studio22.exec@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
[image: 3.png]

The director pitches deadline for this year's Max Saines Grant film "Bad
Habit" written by Maggie Munday Odom has been EXTENDED to NEXT MONDAY,
December 4th 11:59pm CST. Learn more about the film below!

*What is the Max Saines Grant?*

Title: YOU'RE INVITED: NU Animation Jam!
Creator: Minh Bui <minhbui2024@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
*Inviting the RTVF community!*

The student-run *NU Animation Jam* will spotlight the art of animation at a
*FREE* event on Tuesday, November 14, 7pm in Annie May Swift Auditorium.
The event features shorts by students and professional Midwest-based
animators, and a Q&A with the filmmakers in attendance. From stop-motion,
2-D animation, to live action-animation hybrid, the screening showcases
fiction and non-fiction works exploring a wide array of topics, with films
that have played at the Chicago International Film Festival, Melbourne
International Animation Festival, Atlanta Film Festival, and more. [...]

Title: Jordan and Julie Speaker Event THIS Thursday
Creator: Studio 22 Public Relations <studio22.publicity@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Hey everyone!

*MARK YOUR CALENDARS* because this Thursday, November 16th...

Studio 22, in collaboration with Northwestern EPICS, is extremely excited
to present the two outstanding guests of our next speaker event: *Jordan
Horowitz* *(Producer of La La Land, NU SoC'02 alumni)* and *Julia Hart
(Writer/Director of Stargirl, Miss Stevens)*. Both Jordan and Julia have
had extensive careers in the Hollywood film industry, with their expertise
spanning across the fields of producing, writing, and directing. As a
husband and wife creative duo, the pair founded their own film and
television production company Original Headquarters. Join Studio 22 for
this special conversation [...]

Photographers
Videographers

Creator: Francesca Gamba <francescagamba2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Apologies, but here is some further information:

These roles are open to people of all gender identities, and here is a note
from the director:

*"All of the characters should speak as if they are humans and not try to
make themselves sound "insectlike" at all, if that's even possible. All the
lines should be relatively deadpan and spoken like an average person would
say them, not overly emoted. "* [...]

Title: COMMON FLY VOICE OVER CASTING CALL
Creator: Francesca Gamba <francescagamba2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
ANNOUNCING: CASTING CALL FOR
[image: image (2).png]

A Studio 22 Film

Directed and Written by Ian Castracane

Logline: A day in the life of Jeff, an aging housefly in the depths of a
midlife crisis.

Shooting/Recording Winter Quarter

*We are considering students for all roles.*

Jeff (mid 40s): Constantly weary, disappointed, and resigned. Speaks in a
very deadpan manner that reflects his lack of "enthusiasm" for life.
Experiencing a midlife crisis, hates his office job, and his relationship
with his wife is faltering. [...]

Title: SEEKING: Creatives and Performers
Creator: Leo Bloom <efren.ponce2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Many of you would make GREAT performers or collaborators!

VC2 WINTER WEEK 2 WINTER CABARET PRESENTS

ÿ¢ÿ¥€åÿßŸÜ€Å
Aashiyana

A 3 part odyssey showcasing BIPOC characters as they find joy and community through the shared embrace of Culture.

We simply seek (preferably BIPOC) artists who are passionate about the vision for this show, and who can bring their entire selves to the creative process!

Costume Designer

Set Designer

Sound Designer

Marketing Director

Lighting Designer/Assistant Lighting Designer

No experience with designing stage shows is necessary; if you're AT ALL interested, email Shahzeb Shah and Efren to schedule an informal chat.

ALSO:

OPEN CALL

Mon Oct 16 6:45-8:45p in Parkes Hall 222

Click here for our info sheet. Sign up here for the open call.

We're looking for any BIPOC performers who are passionate about cultural embrace and unity! We CANNOT wait to have various cultures represented.

Title: Discussion: The Role of AI in the WGA Strike
Creator: Asha Buerk <ashabuerk2026@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
What role does AI play in screenwriting? What settlement did the writer's
guild reach, and is it sustainable? How does artificial intelligence impact
human creativity? Join RAISO this Wednesday (10/11) at 7 PM in Lunt Hall
101 to discuss all these questions and enjoy FREE Tomate burritos!!

RSVP here for free burritos:

Title: Call for Entry: NORTHWESTERN ANIMATION JAM!
Creator: Minh Bui <minhbui2024@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
[image: NUAnimationJam.jpg]
Calling all animators and Chicagoland cartoon creators!
The Northwestern Animation Jam aims to celebrate the art of animation and
the talents of student animators and the Chicagoland animation community as
a whole. Our student-run festival is currently accepting submissions for
animated shorts and features made by students and filmmakers living in the
Midwest. Deadline for submissions is Sunday, October 15th, 2023. There is
no entry fee, films don‚Äôt have to be recent productions. Selected
filmmakers will also have the opportunity to participate in a panel or Q&A
session.
The festival will be held at Northwestern University‚Äôs Annie May [...]

Title: GRIFFIN'S TALE SHOW + AUDITIONS!
Creator: Sophie Brown <sophiebrown2024@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
HEY RTVF!

Do you thinks kids are funny???? ‚Ä¶ No way. US TOO!!! Let's hangout.

We're Griffin's Tale, Northwestern's only children's repertory theatre company!! We take stories written by elementary school kids and adapt them into skits, songs, raps, dances...you name it. THEN, we take those stories to elementary schools around the Chicago area and perform their stories for them. [...]

Title: HEY RTVF, JOIN THE NORTHWESTERN ART REVIEW
Creator: Madeleine Giaconia <madiegiaconia2024@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
The Northwestern Art Review (NAR) is an undergraduate organization based at
Northwestern University that seeks to promote the arts. NAR publishes an
annual research journal of art scholarship and critique; maintains an online
website <https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://www.northwesternartreview.org/__;!!Dq0X2DkFhyF93HkjWTBQKhk!U0P1bKXmhMRqCNH9r1eV6GeLVCJc3u4LaIbJA3NAmqW4t_o11-ogwdssL_UZpZRPcgnZuOjhqdOIqwdrm1rgDYV1_wG73vWB8J7AMs_dBQcF6EGjEA$ > about arts and culture;

artistic leaders; and hosts diverse events to build community and have fun! [...]

Title: CALL FOR EXTRAS FOR "YELLOW REVERIE" Oct 6-9
Creator: Anna Castagnaro <annacastagnaro2024@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
[image: Untitled design.png]

Written and Directed by Maddie Morse

Produced by Bridget Roberts and Anna Castagnaro

Shooting: Weekend 3 of Fall Quarter (October 6-9)

Logline:

Leena, a young florist with a unique ability to see the magic in the world,
discovers a mysterious connection with Dean, an enigmatic stranger. As
their encounters blur the line between imagination and reality, Leena
embarks on a journey of self-discovery, unlocking the power of perception,
connection, isolation, and the transformative beauty hidden within the
mundane. [...]

Description:
Crew Call for Photo Shoot: Posing Mental Health

Sponsored by the Pritzker Pucker Studio Lab for the Promotion of Mental
Health Via the Cinematic Arts

Short Pitch: We will be restaging Hugh Diamond‚Äôs most popular photo: Seated
Woman with Bird (see pitch packet). Diamond used photography to document
the expressions of female patients in the Surrey County Asylum. His photos
were supposedly humane and objective, but really they were highly staged
and relied on iconography. We can do better! [...]

Title: DEI Workshop: Problems and Solutions in the Creative Fields with Al Heartley, Thursday May 18th
Creator: Shannon C Pritchard <shannon.pritchard@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
[cid:2a2a08b1-8573-4fab-8be6-aa7b06eb083f]<https://apply.soc.northwestern.edu/register/?id=29f1836c-cff1-43e6-9dd4-ef8d46f2ec44>

Hello!

We are happy to welcome any SoC professional graduate programs students that would be interested in attending this workshop next month. The visual is hyperlinked, or you can use the link below to register. Please reach out if there are any questions

The workshop will tackle major issues and controversies that surround the work of Equity, Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging, and explore a variety of problems that have occurred in the creative field as well as explore offerings of practical solutions and examine their effectiveness.
The workshop will be held at The Garage, on Thursday, May 18th, from [...]

Title: Wirtz Facilitated Forum
Creator: Ryan Nguyen <ryannguyen2024@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Wirtz Facilitated Forum

The Wirtz Center is the home of theatre, music theatre, and dance at
Northwestern University, mounting over 40 productions annually.
Undergraduate actors, managers, and playwrights, alongside graduate
designers, directors, and dramaturgs, collaborate on works both classic and
contemporary for audiences of all ages.

The Wirtz Center is hosting a facilitated forum for students of color to
engage in dialogues regarding processes and practices on May 8th at 5pm in
the Cellar, with managing director Jorge Silva, Musical Theatre faculty KO, MFA
Tor Campbell, and chair of theatre faculty Henry Godinez. [...]

Title: Screening TONIGHT with DIRECTOR Q&A
Creator: Audrey Henry <AudreyHenry2023@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi everyone!

Wanted to let you guys know about a great opportunity tonight to get to
meet indie director Dominic Gagnon! We'll be leading an open Q&A with him
after screening his 012 film *Hoax_Canular* in Louis 119 at 9PM tonight.
Sourced from over 70 hours of Youtube footage, *Hoax_Canular* is a survey
of teenagers coping with the purported doomsday of 2012 from the
perspective of low-res web-cameras. Ironic humor, religious fervor, and
existential dread come together in a montage of lonely testimonies shouted
into the void. A decade after its release, Dominic Gagnon's film remains a
fascinating and relevant [...]

Description:
Hullo,

Northwestern Cinematheque here, the destination for film lovers,
(film)makers and *film*keepers pushing the bounds of cinema watching for
all.!

In addition to film programming, we‚Äôre looking to launch a zine that acts
as a companion to our film screenings. The theme this quarter is *the

and anything else you think we could cram in there. Up to you. Deadline to
submit is May 12th. Email entries to nu.cinematheque@gmail.com , make sure
to include your name. [...]

Title: ANNOUNCING EXEC PETITIONS FOR MULTI-CULTI
Creator: Multi Culti <nu.multiculti@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Hello!

The Multicultural Filmmakers Collective (MFC/MultiCulti) is holding
petitions this* Tuesday *and *Thursday* for our 2023-2024 Executive Board.

*Who are we and what do we do? *

Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is a student-run production company
that aims to provide an encouraging environment for the burgeoning
creativity of multicultural student filmmakers. The purpose of the
Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is to nurture, promote, and ally
multicultural student filmmakers at Northwestern University, as well as
support student films that present multicultural concerns and experiences.
We define multicultural as including, but not limited to, underrepresented
races, ethnicities, and religions. In addition to general meetings, [...]

Title: NU Cinematheque Presents: A Self-Induced Hallucination (with Director Jane Schoenbrun) -- TOMORROW 4/21 @ 7PM
Creator: Nick Schoenbrodt <nickschoenbrodt2023@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi everyone,

Northwestern Cinematheque is happy to announce a screening of Jane
Schoenbrun's 2018 documentary A Self-Induced Hallucination. The event will
take place tomorrow (April 21st) at the Block Cinema at 7:00pm.

A precursor to Schoenbrun's low-budget darling We're All Going To The
World's Fair, this formerly lost documentary is a deeply sensitive and
empathetic look at Slenderman and Creepypasta communities and is one of the
few good movies ever made about the internet. It‚Äôs also very much so a
moodboard for We‚Äôre All Going to the World‚Äôs Fair, and there‚Äôs all sorts of
beautiful hidden details and commonalities linking [...]

Title: Crew Call for Short Film ‚ÄúHadley‚Äôs Home‚Äù
Creator: Adelaide Young <adelaideyoung2024@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Crew Call for Short Film ‚ÄúHadley‚Äôs Home‚Äù

Thanks to the Pritzker Pucker Studio Lab for the Promotion of Mental Health
Via the Cinematic Arts

Spring Week 9

Writer/Director: Kailey Morand

Co-Writer/Producer: Adelaide Ray Young

"Hadley's Home" follows Emma, a 9 year old girl whose big sister Hadley is
returning home from the hospital after a suicide attempt. This
slice-of-life film will investigate the nuances of a female family dynamic
after an intense mental health experience. Please see this folder
<https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1epbi7lIb0uO5XBPw2srZbrf1mnI8b39s?usp=sharing__;!!Dq0X2DkFhyF93HkjWTBQKhk!Wy7QcZqDKaZd4utOf_WTCo4SJEkRkTk_ZvnII9WXHPzVDX_M2pl5r0qRj5CmlxCY57wiROfln7rPED6BCKa9Clui5dwpiO92LwBt-ZF7aEgagQeAEQ$ >

Title: Re: Northwestern Cinematheque Screening Tomorrow!
Creator: Audrey Henry <AudreyHenry2023@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Dear RTVF Community,

Due to HBO's business practices of permanently shelving their own films
while scrubbing any trace of them from other streaming platforms, we have
had to change our program for tonight. Please join us in to instead watch
L.A.-based art collective Everything is Terrible!'s 2018 film *The Great
Satan*! Construed from hundreds of long-forgotten VHS tapes, The Great
Satan offers a comprehensive look at cinematic depictions of evil incarnate
in a fun, fast-paced, and funny 'story' Hyperactive, absurd, and designed
to be watched in a large, confused audience, *The Great Satan *gets about
as close as we to [...]

Title: Northwestern Cinematheque Screening Tomorrow!
Creator: Audrey Henry <audreyhenry2023@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
RTVF Community,

We are excited to announce the beginning of a new screening series and club on-campus! Northwestern Cinematheque seeks to empower students by allowing them the opportunity to see films hand-picked by their peers and a chance to create a program themselves. We're working with the Block to set-up some bigger events for this year and the future, but we will also be hosting these weekly underground screenings in Louis 119 for the rest of the quarter. We already have some of our slate lined up, but if you're looking to get involved and show more people a movie [...]

Cast/Crew Call for Short Film ‚ÄúHadley‚Äôs Home‚Äù

Title: URGENTLY SEEKING: Stage Manager for Blackout Live Show
Creator: efren. <efren.ponce2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hey RTVF!

The Blackout, NU’s late-night comedy group, has our Winter Live Show coming up on Saturday, March 11 at McCormick Auditorium, and we are urgently seeking a Stage Manager!

The job will include helping us set up our sound system, running the livestream, managing transitions between filmed/live segments, etc. which is all super fun stuff  

You’d work with the Live Show Producer to ensure that all equipment is properly set up and that we are able to create an awesome performance both for the folks in the room and the people watching at home. The Stage Manager also works with the Live Show team to direct the technical side of the show while it is occurring!

But ofc you won't have to work alone; we will all be learning and working together to make everything go as smoothly as possible.

Minimal experience is required, so if you are at all interested in this position, or know anyone who might be, please reach out to theblackout@u.northwestern.edu.

Feel free to email us with any questions you might have about the position or the live show in general.

Thanks!!

<3 Blackout Exec

p.s. Check out our past live shows on YouTube for inspo on why you should apply :)

Title: CoPilot Season: Join the 2023-24 Exec Board of A NEW STUDENT ORG FOR TV WRITING
Creator: Efren Ponce <efren.ponce2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
BUT FIRST: What is CoPilot?

A space for screenwriters of any experience level to join forces to produce something magical: a complete set of 30min scripts for an entire 4-6 episode* miniseries, each quarter. In Layman's terms, a mock TV writers' room. Ownership of the final product is collective.

•

Leading CoPilot in its inaugural year is by no means an easy task, but it is an experiment for which the executive board will cement plans and establish a sustainable means of moving forward, so please apply. No Google Form application is required! Exec meetings begin the week after petitions so we can be prepared for regularly scheduled programming in spring.

•

HERE is where you'll find info on exec board positions.

HERE is where you'll schedule an appointment for petitions. Reach out to us if none of these times work for you.

•

Ideally, exec members should have screenwriting experience (Prerequisite: Foundations of Screenwriting ugh sounds like a course description I know). Haven't taken RTVF 260 yet, or can't commit as an exec member? Stay tuned for more info on how to join as a writer…

•

PLEASE reach out with questions! (If you click on our hyperlinked names, it'll automatically generate an email draft.) More info about the overall club is coming VERY soon.

•

Looking forward to meeting you all ;D

Nathaniel & efren.

*not set in stone; could be more, could be less

Title: SEEKING ACTORS and Crew for MFA Short Film BAD BLOOD
Creator: Katherine Mcmorran <katherinemcmorran2024@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
CAST/CREW CALL

Seeking actors for the short film BAD BLOOD - a proof of concept for a hybrid documentary written and directed by MFA Doc Media student Obed Lamy.

LOGLINE:
A Haitian woman was ready to make her first blood donation at a blood drive held at her workplace in Boston. It was 1984, and the AIDS epidemic was taking its toll, doubly so in the Haitian community, which bore the stigma of being the source of the disease. Things went wrong for her, and the event of that day pushed her to dedicate her life to defending her community. [...]

Title: Recruiting RTVF Students for Research Study
Creator: Charles Cui <charlescui@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi,

We are looking for participants for a research study to better understand
how people are
interpreting different visualizations (graphs).

This research study consists of two parts: (1) completing a questionnaire
while thinking
out loud and (2) participating in a semi-structured interview. For the
questionnaire, there
will be one visualization (graph) associated with each question, and the
questions will
be multiple-choice questions. You will be asked to give your best answer to
each
question while thinking out loud. For the interview, you will be asked some
questions on
your experience with the questionnaire. The entire study will be conducted
over
[...]

Title: Join the Team for "How We Got On"!
Creator: Journey Cole <journeycole2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
üéßHow We Got Onüé§
Written by Idris Goodwin
Directed by Journey Cole
Produced by Anushka Agarwala
WAVE Spring Week 1 in Shanley

*Synopsis:* A play about three talented, determined black teens coming of
age in the 1980s. They must overcome cultural isolation, familial
dysfunction, and ruthless rivalries to make the music that defines their
lives. A DJ spins their stories with her own meta-theatrical perspective in
this contemporary ode to the roots of rap.
*Read more about the play here!

Description:
SEEKING SOUND RECORDIST

OOPS! I‚ÄôVE BEEN DRIVEN MUNDANE

a Senior Directing Film

Written and Directed by Nick Schoenbrodt

Description:
FAKE LOVE: A Reality TV Audiodrama

Directed by by Eislow Johnson (MA in Sound Arts and Industries 2023)

SYNOPSIS: One young single (the LEAD), fed up with lies, secrets and hidden
agendas, will be going on a series of sonic dates to find someone ~real.
They will be dating a host of actors: some who are playing characters, some
who are being their actual selves, and some who are a mix of both. The
SUITORS will have to convince the LEAD that they‚Äôre genuine in order to
stay on the show ‚Äî and win the LEAD‚Äôs heart. [...]

*Max Saines (SoC, ‚Äò13) was a beloved member of the Northwestern community
and a proud Studio 22 alum. Max passed away in June of 2019 and is
remembered by many for his work at Northwestern, Endeavor Content, and

Title: Upcoming Block Cinema screening: ¬°QUEIMADA! (BURN!, 1969) on 35mm - 10/13
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
RTVF Community,

Please see the announcement below.

UPCOMING BLOCK CINEMA EVENT (10/13)

Thursday, October 13th at 7 pm: ¬°QUEIMADA! (BURN!) (1969)

More info & RSVP<https://www.blockmuseum.northwestern.edu/cinema/2022/queimada-burn,-1969.html>

[cid:e844eddc-2511-41dc-a645-a9b113a45fcc]
Image credit: "Queimada!" (1969) by Gillo Pontecorvo

Gillo Pontecorvo's 1966 landmark docudrama BATTLE OF ALGIERS gave the world a front-line report on the ongoing struggle for independence in Northern Africa. Although it takes place more than a century earlier, his follow-up, ¬°QUEIMADA!, is in some ways the more prescient film, predicting the insidious neo-colonialist strategies that would ensnare emerging nations in the decades to come. A historical fiction about insurrection-for-profit, ¬°QUEIMADA! narrates the myth [...]

Title: Great Lakes Association for Sound Studies (GLASS)
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
RTVF Community,

Please see the announcement below.

Join the Great Lakes Association for Sound Studies (GLASS) for our first conference in Canada this weekend, hosted by the Department of Media, Art and Performance at the University of Regina. GLASS Canada: Listening as a Shared and Social Practice is a hybrid conference that will take place October 7 and 8 at the University of Regina in Saskatchewan, Canada. The conference will consist of two days of panels, performances, and workshops and will feature a keynote address by xmelmexw (ST6:15/Skwah) artist, curator, and writer Dylan Robinson. [...]

Title: Apply to NUDM 2023 Committees!
Creator: Grace Dyer and Josh Ryan <productions@NUDM.ORG>
Description:
Applications to join an NUDM Committee are LIVE!

This year, we are partnering with Little Heroes League, a nonprofit
organization that provides care coordination services to the most medically
complex babies born in Chicagoland and beyond, helping the babies and their
families thrive. NUDM‚Äôs grant will allow Little Heroes League to onboard
additional care coordinators and extend resources to over 250 more families
than they currently serve. Get involved with one of our 10 committees to
organize the yearlong effort and participate in NUDM from start to finish.
It's a great way to give back, gain leadership experience, and make [...]

Title: RTVF Fall Workshops!
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
RTVF Faculty, Instructors, and Students,

Please see the announcement below.

The Department of RTVF is offering several Fall Workshops and you can enroll using a handy new online signup system!
RTVF workshops will be held in the second and third week of each quarter, from 10am - 6pm with a 1-hour lunch break. Students must attend the entire workshop. Workshops are needed to check out certain items of film equipment - NOTE: Individual / one-on-one sessions are no longer being offered.
To enroll for a workshop, go to the new link at the RTVF "For Current Students" webpage:
https://communication.northwestern.edu/radio-television-film/for-current-rtvf-students/

Title: ANNOUNCING: Casting Call for "Upon the Sea"
Creator: Sheng Sally <lansheng87@OUTLOOK.COM>
Description:
Casting Call For:
[cid2372516075*image001.jpg@01D8C889.C59969B0]

UPON THE SEA
A NUWFA Grant Film
Written & Directed by Rosalie Liu
Produced by Lan Sheng

Shooting tentatively Week 7 (11/4-11/6) or Week 8 (11/11-11/13)

"Immersed in the guilt of missing her deceased granny's last words, a college senior goes on a dreamy journey while hesitating to pursue her own dream."

CHARACTER DESCRIPTIONS
JADE (LEAD, East Asian, female/non-binary): A sensitive, acute, imaginative poet who feels guilty about missing her deceased granny's last words.
MOM* (East Asian, female/non-binary, Mandarin Speaking Role): A caring mother who supports Jade's dream but unintentionally pressures her. [...]

Title: FW: Casting Call: BeSpoken Film Shoot on 8/28 @ 9am
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
RTVF Undergrads,

Please see the opportunity below.

Hi RTVF!

My name is Zack Coen and I'm a recent graduate from the Kellogg School of Management as well as co-founder and CEO of BeSpoken<https://www.bespokenlanguage.com/>, a conversational language learning startup dedicated to removing the anxiety and fear that comes with learning a new language.

We are looking for a few Northwestern University undergraduate actors to help us develop some video content for our startup next week. The opportunity is for short-form video content (~3-5mins per video) focusing on real-life, American experiences to give non-native English learners the chance to practice culturally-relevant English [...]

Title: Fall Remote Internship Opportunity - Captivate Entertainment
Creator: Nico Sagnelli <nicosagnelli2023@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
*Captivate Internship Description:*
Seeking interns interested in Feature/TV development for the producers of
the Jason Bourne franchise. Internship will begin on/around September 1st,
2022 and go until on/around December 15th. Duties will include project
research, reading, script and book coverage, and administrative tasks.

Captivate Entertainment is a production company with a first-look deal at
Universal Studios. We are based out of the Universal Studios lot in
Universal City, CA. This is a great opportunity for a crash-course in story
and development for aspiring producers, screenwriters, and directors. [...]

Want to write a micro budget feature-length film? Have a script you want

Title: Seeking Animator for ‚ÄúThe Companionship of Family‚Äù
Creator: Peining Jia <peiningjia2023@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi all,

‚ÄúThe Companionship of Family‚Äù is a short animation project produced by the
Black Graduate Artist Group (BGAG), written & directed by Elliot Marvin
Sims and produced by Peining Jia.

A coming-of-age tale of an orphan strayed boy and street-savvy English
Bulldog that inspires him to believe family is about the magic of
togetherness, and how looking out for someone else has a certain magic of
its own. [...]

Title: SEEKING: ACTORS & HMU ARTIST [PAID]
Creator: Hannah So <hannahso2022@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hey everyone,

Museum of Ice Cream is looking for actors and a HMU artist for an upcoming
shoot!

It'll be two half-day shoots from 9am-4pm on *July 12th* (photoshoot) and *July
13th* (video shoot). Location is Tribune Tower. Pay is $200 per half day.
Free ice cream + lunch provided :)

ACTORS INFO:

- Looking for actors who can act in upbeat promotional video and also
model for group photoshoot. Specifically looking for:
- 1x Child Male (age 6 - 10)

Title: Casting Call: BeSpoken, a Northwestern University Language Learning Startup
Creator: Zack Lessans Coen <zack.coen@KELLOGG.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi RTVF!

My name is Zack Coen and I'm a recent graduate from the Kellogg School of Management as well as co-founder and CEO of BeSpoken<https://www.bespokenlanguage.com/>, a conversational language learning startup dedicated to removing the anxiety and fear that comes with learning a new language.

We have recently received some additional funding, and one of our goals for this funding for the summer is to continue to level up the quality of our video content. We are already working with a Northwestern University filmmaker and would love to keep this opportunity entirely within the Northwestern family by collaborating with 2-3 [...]

Title: Paid+Remote Summer Game Development Opportunity for Northwestern Students
Creator: Austin Lopez <austinlopez2022@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
*Paid+Remote Summer Game Development Opportunity for Northwestern
Students*[image:
image.png]
*Screenshot of one of the previously developed games*

In 2020, a group of undergraduate computer science students at Northwestern
collaborated to create four educational video game experiences
<https://www.mccormick.northwestern.edu/news/articles/2020/09/making-a-game-out-of-case-studies.html>
to be used in a classroom environment. These games have garnered highly
positive feedback from students and became a core part of the learning
experience. This year, we are taking new steps to improve and expand one of
these games and turn it into a greater and more sophisticated experience. [...]

Title: Reminder: Kevin Everson in-person screening at the Block tonight (5/27 at 7PM)
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
RTVF Community,

Please see the reminder below.
____

BLOCK CINEMA PRESENTS:

5/27 at 7 PM: THE ISLAND OF ST MATTHEWS with Kevin Jerome Everson (2013, 70 min, DCP) preceded by a short selection of South Side Home Movie Project films + Q&A with the filmmaker - FREE RSVP<https://www.blockmuseum.northwestern.edu/cinema/2022/the-island-of-st-matthews-2013-with-kevin-jerome-everson.html>

Renowned filmmaker Kevin Jerome Everson appears in person to present the Chicagoland debut of his 2013 feature, THE ISLAND OF ST MATTHEWS. A portrait of collective memory, lost family artifacts, and the lived experience of ecological change, ISLAND trains its lens on his parents' hometown of Westport, a rural community outside of [...]

*Casting for Comedia Film Trailer project.*

[image: Sor_Juana_by_Miguel_Cabrera.png]

I am seeking three actors for a PAID GIG end of June/beginning of July.
This project is a short experimental film trailer/scene of a Spanish Golden
Age ‚Äòcomedia‚Äô play in English-language translation, adapted for film
medium. The play, ‚ÄòLove is the Greater Labyrinth‚Äô (by 17th-century Mexican

Theseus and the Minotaur. Characters being cast are: *TESEO*, the Athenian
prince, in love with Fedra; and the [...]

Title: Thurs. 5/19 at 7pm - Performance - FIRE THE HIRE: Fanning the Flames
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
RTVF Community,

The Pritzker Pucker Studio Lab for the Promotion of Mental Health via Cinematic Arts invites you!

FIRE THE HIRE: Fanning the Flames

By Eliza Bent

Thursday, May 19 | 7:00 p.m.
Abbott Hall 203

710 N. Lake Shore Drive, Chicago

RSVP required:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/fire-the-hire-fanning-the-flames-by-eliza-bent-tickets-308968451957

In 2014 Eliza Bent did a one-night performance, Fire the Hire, in which she dressed as her Boss doing stand-up about what a bad employee and bride-to-be she was. Eight years later, Bent revisits this pivotal performance, a portrait of her work and life and asks: Is Enlightenment possible? [...]

Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
RTVF Community,

Please see the reminder below.

ARTIST TALK: LaToya Ruby Frazier on Art, Social Justice, & Health Equity

[cid:180be5e00e74ce8e91]

In 2016, artist, activist, and MacArthur genius awardee LaToya Ruby Frazier spent five months living in Flint, Michigan to document how working-class families of color survived one of the most devastating ecological disasters in U.S. history. In this artist talk, Frazier will share images and insights into her photographic work FLINT IS FAMILY, as well as reflections on her current project about the impacts of COVID-19 on Black communities. [...]

Title: RTVF Summer Course- Teen-Centered Stories for the Screen and Stage
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
For RTVF Students:

Upcoming Summer Course Offering:

Teen-Centered Stories for the Screen and Stage
Professor Ariel Stess

Summer Session 1
RTVF 360-36
Six-Week Session | 6/21/22 - 7/31/22

Narratives about teens are thrilling, complex, and widely popular. In this class, students will tap into their experience of being a teen, explore dramatic and comedic tropes, and write compelling teen-centered stories for the screen and stage. Works we may view or read include Never Have I Ever, Euphoria, Lady Bird, Normal People, Grown-ish, and Peerless. The course will be workshop centered, which means that during class, we'll regularly read classmates' script [...]

Citizen Skull, an LA based production and management company, is looking for remote Scripted Development interns for June-August. Title: Casting Call: BeSpoken, a Northwestern University Language Learning Startup
Creator: Zack Lessans Coen <zack.coen@KELLOGG.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi RTVF!

My name is Zack Coen and I'm a second year MBA candidate in the Kellogg School of Management as well as a cofounder of BeSpoken<https://www.bespokenlanguage.com/>, a conversational language learning startup dedicated to removing the anxiety and fear that comes with learning a new language.

We have recently received some additional funding, and one of our goals for this funding for the Spring quarter is to level up the quality of our video content. We are already working with a Northwestern University filmmaker and would love to keep this opportunity entirely within the Northwestern family by collaborating with 2-3 [...]

Title: Announcing the 2022 RTVF Screenwriting Prizes
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
THE 2022 RTVF SCREENWRITING PRIZES

Eligibility:
A. RTVF MAJORS graduating during the 2021-2022 academic year
Award pool:
The first place winner will receive $1,000
Two second place winners will each receive $750.
Please note: Depending on your employment and/or funding status at Northwestern, the money in this award could be considered taxable income. This means that payroll taxes may be taken out of your award check.
Script Eligibility:
A. Original scripts: Feature films and TV pilots (1/2 hour/1 hour/On-going mini-series). One submission per student.
B. Scripts must have been completed in an RTF writing class. Although it is not necessary, [...]

Title: Reminder: TOMORROW @ 3:30pm: Netflix showrunner, TV writer and playwright MOLLY SMITH METZLER in conversation with award-winning author RACHEL DEWOSKIN!
Creator: Shannon C Pritchard <shannon.pritchard@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
A not-to-be missed in-person event:

Students should RSVP on Handshake:<https://app.joinhandshake.com/edu/events/1035299>

RSVP is not required for faculty and staff

[cid:image002.png@01D8606A.80850230]

Molly Smith Metzler is a playwright and screenwriter from Kingston, New York. She is the creator and showrunner of the limited series Maid (Netflix), which she executive produced alongside John Wells and Margot Robbie's LuckyChap Entertainment for WB. Her TV credits include three seasons of Shameless (Showtime), two seasons of Casual(Hulu) and Orange Is the New Black (Netflix). In film, Metzler has written features for Made Up Stories, Disney, Universal, and Fox 2000. Currently, she is adapting the graphic novel Dan [...]

Title: SEEKING TIK-TOK MANAGER FOR DOCUMENTARY "THE GRAY AREA"
Creator: Sierra Thoulouis <sierrathoulouis2019@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
SEEKING TIK-TOK MANAGER

FOR DOCUMENTARY THE GRAY AREA

CW: Sexual Assualt

The Gray Area, is a documentary following the harrowing and healing
journey that a childhood sexual assault survivor (Raechel Karas) endures
while trying to seek justice for the wrongs of the past. Seventeen years
after the abuse took place and with the window for legal justice narrowing,
Raechel begins the process of preparing to formally file a police report
and seek any legal action possible against her abuser, while also
discovering a system that doesn‚Äôt support survivors on their road to
justice and closure. [...]

Title: NEW MULTICULTURAL STUDENT THEATRE BOARD!
Creator: Journey Cole <journeycole2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hey Y'all! We are so excited to announce the launch of Vibrant Colors
Collective, the only NU theatre organization that strives to approach and
produce theatre from a multicultural lens. We are so happy to be able to
create a collaborative and creative space for all People of Color. Vibrant
Colors Collective (VC2) is having an info night on April 7 and April 11 at
5 pm in Harris Hall, and anyone can come. We repeat ANYONE, we want to make
everyone know that this is not just an organization for theatre kids,

Title: THE WAA-MU SHOW PRESENTS....
Creator: Evelyn Mulchrone <evelynmulchrone2025@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
The Waa-Mu Show Presents‚Ä¶

A NIGHT WITH THE BEAUCORTS

Saturday, April 9th @6:30pm

Antiques. Socialites. Secrets. Join us at the manor of Archibald Beaucourt
to share stories of The 91st Annual Waa-Mu Show, A Peculiar Inheritance!

The night begins with a roundtable discussion about the show‚Äôs development,
with presentations from our Writing Coordinators and Designers about the
world of the show. We then move to a panel of past Waa-Mu members,
recalling their fondest memories of Waa-Mu and how it has influenced their
lives today. The night concludes with a performance by Waa-2, giving guests
a sneak preview at the [...]

Title: ANNOUNCING: Petitions for Vertigo!
Creator: Tessa Kim <tessakim2024@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
PETITION FOR VERTIGO PRODUCTIONS

The theatre board dedicated entirely to new work!

Vertigo Productions is the only Northwestern theatre organization devoted
entirely to producing new work created by Northwestern students. We give
undergraduate playwrights the opportunity to have their original works
realized into full-fledged productions, staged readings, and workshops.

Petitions are happening today (Monday), Thursday, and Friday! Come sign up
and chat with us! It will be a super chill convo where we learn about you
and your passions for new work! No need to prep anything!! We have no
written petition ;) You do not have to be a [...]

Title: Fwd: CASTING CALL SHROOMERS
Creator: Maria Ginther <mariaginther2023@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Bump on this! Please submit you tapes!

Written by Abby Alleyne Brooke

Directed by Sophie De Bruijn

Produced by Katie Brodsky and Sam Friedman

Logline: The exploits of a group of mushroom enthusiasts whose membership
consists of senior citizens (Boomers) and college-age kids (Zoomers).

The Evanston Fungi Friends (EFF for short) grow and sell mushrooms, embark
on foraging expeditions, and attend fungi conferences and festivals
throughout the upper midwest. The mushrooming community used to be
exclusively populated by NPR-listening, bifocal-wearing retirees; but as
Gen Z has come of age, their interest in the environment, veganism, and
altering their own brain [...]

Title: ANNOUNCING: MULTICULTI EXEC PETITIONS
Creator: Multi Culti <nu.multiculti@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Hi RTVF,

The Multicultural Filmmakers Collective (MFC, MultiCulti) is holding
petitions *this Thursday and Friday* for our 2022-2023 Executive Board.

*Who are we and what do we do? *

Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is a student-run production company
that aims to provide an encouraging environment for the burgeoning
creativity of multicultural student filmmakers. The purpose of the
Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is to nurture, promote, and ally
multicultural student filmmakers at Northwestern University, as well as
support student films that present multicultural concerns and experiences.
We define multicultural as including, but not limited to, underrepresented
races, ethnicities, religions, genders, sexual orientations, and
[...]

compensation, location, any relevant details. Thank you so much!!

Title: Fwd: CASTING CALL SHROOMERS
Creator: Maria Ginther <mariaginther2023@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Written by Abby Alleyne Brooke

Directed by Sophie De Bruijn

Produced by Katie Brodsky and Sam Friedman

Logline: The exploits of a group of mushroom enthusiasts whose membership
consists of senior citizens (Boomers) and college-age kids (Zoomers).

The Evanston Fungi Friends (EFF for short) grow and sell mushrooms, embark
on foraging expeditions, and attend fungi conferences and festivals
throughout the upper midwest. The mushrooming community used to be
exclusively populated by NPR-listening, bifocal-wearing retirees; but as
Gen Z has come of age, their interest in the environment, veganism, and
altering their own brain chemistry has led them into the wonderful [...]

-Understanding of my creative style & personality :) [...]

Title: Remote Winter/Spring Internship Opportunity
Creator: Zoe Port <zoeport2022@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
If you're looking for a remote internship:

CASTLE ROCK ENTERTAINMENT INTERNSHIP:

Castle Rock Entertainment (When Harry Met Sally, The Shawshank Redemption,
LBJ, Seinfeld) is seeking development interns for the Spring semester. This
position is fully remote but provides an invaluable opportunity to work
closely with the film development team at an iconic label. Duties range
from reading incoming submissions, to drafting script coverage, providing
market research, grid management, as well participation in mock pitch
training sessions. The position requires a 2-3 day per week commitment with
the opportunity to grow into full-time for the right candidates. Applicants
must be goal-oriented, [...]

Hey RTVF!

NUWFA is extremely excited to be welcoming back Meezahn Senbetta, Class of 2020, to screen her NUWFA film ‚ÄúRelease.‚Äù

After the death of her husband and mounting concerns from those around her, a quick-witted elderly woman embarks on a journey to release decades of bottled emotions.

[...]

Title: ANNOUNCING: Multi Culti Executive Board Petitions
Creator: Multi Culti <nu.multiculti@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Hi RTVF,

Multi Culti is holding Co-Treasurer and Co-Grant Chair petitions on Wednesday
and Thursday from 7-9pm for our Executive Board.

Who are we and what do we do?

Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is a student-run production company
that aims to provide an encouraging environment for the burgeoning
creativity of multicultural student filmmakers. The purpose of the
Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is to nurture, promote, and ally
multicultural student filmmakers at Northwestern University, as well as
support student films that present multicultural concerns and experiences.
We define multicultural as including, but not limited to, underrepresented
races, ethnicities, religions, genders, sexual orientations, and
[...]

Hi all! Check out the Handshake posting to register: https://northwestern.joinhandshake.com/events/890834.

Creative Artists Agency (CAA) is the leading entertainment and sports agency, with global expertise in filmed and live entertainment, digital media, publishing, sponsorship sales and endorsements, media finance, consumer investing, fashion, trademark licensing, and philanthropy. Distinguished by its culture of collaboration and exceptional client service, CAA's diverse workforce identifies, innovates, and amplifies opportunities [...]

Title: ANNOUNCING: Multi Culti Executive Board Petitions
Creator: Multi Culti <nu.multiculti@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Hi RTVF,

The Multicultural Filmmakers Collective (MFC, Multi Culti) is holding
Co-Programming
Chair and Co-Industry Chair petitions on Tuesday from 3-5pm for our
2021-2022 Executive Board.
[image: MultiCulti Exec Graphic v2.jpg]

Who are we and what do we do?

Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is a student-run production company
that aims to provide an encouraging environment for the burgeoning
creativity of multicultural student filmmakers. The purpose of the
Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is to nurture, promote, and ally
multicultural student filmmakers at Northwestern University, as well as
support student films that present multicultural concerns and experiences.
We define multicultural as including, but not [...]

Title: Lipstick Standup!
Creator: Alyssa Hill <alyssahill2022@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
*Lipstick Theatre Stand-Up Fall 2021*

*Calling all funny folks!* Lipstick Stand-Up is intended for performers *whose
gender identity has traditionally been left out of stand-up comedy* (ex.
cis women, non-binary, trans folx, etc.). You DO NOT need experience with
stand-up comedy to perform!! :)

Workshops to hone your set will be on Tuesdays from 8-9pm or 9-10pm from
10/12 to 11/9 with a rehearsal and performance on *Thursday 11/11 or Sunday
11/14.* No audition/application is necessary, but we are accepting
first-come-first-serve through our interest form
<https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://536dcf2d-2221-4742-a665-4f2ddfa46b74.mailbutler.link/p2/c4afdc72-6c33-44f5-8205-a0cb43d367c9/9c3d92bb-22d5-450f-8f1b-4b5c9edab57d__;!!Dq0X2DkFhyF93HkjWTBQKhk!Fz9DaeMfB8zTNE1gYgesfw-EIIxJZKaLuAoVkHML7SBekKrQMS7cIUw2zyXw653BYaYIEqTms9ya$ >

Title: S22, NUWFA, MFC, URSA Present: "Extracurricular Filmmaking 101"
Creator: Studio 22 Exec <studio22.exec@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
[image: Filmmaking 101.png]

Hello and happy fall!

*Studio 22 Productions (S22) *is collaborating with *The Northwestern
Women's Filmmaker Alliance (NUWFA)*, *The Multi-Cultural Filmmaking
Collective (MFC)*, and the *Undergraduate Radio/Television/Film Student
Association (URSA)* to put on *"Extracurricular Filmmaking 101"* on *Tuesday,
September 28 *from *9‚Äì10:30pm *in* Louis Hall 106*. This event is designed
to help orient and introduce students to the basics of extracurricular film
production at Northwestern. This event is open to students of all
experience levels and majors who are looking to get involved with the
filmmaking scene on campus. [...]

22's *2021-2022 Max Saines Grant Film*! Learn more about her film below!

*What is the Max Saines Grant?*
*Max Saines (RTVF 2013) was a beloved member of the Northwestern community
and a proud Studio 22 alum. Max passed away in June of 2019 and is
remembered by many for his work at Northwestern, Endeavor Content, and
beyond. In his honor, the $5,000 Max Saines Grant will be offered yearly to
a writer/director team. This grant is made possible by Emily Gerson [...]

Title: Seeking Film Director for Project HEAL
Creator: Joyce Pu <joycepu2023@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Seeking Film Director for

‚ö°‚ö°‚ö°Project HEAL‚ö°‚ö°‚ö°

* Performing Fall Week 6 *

as part of Spectrum's Firelight Festival of Devised Works

Directed by Joyce Pu

*What can we*, as artists, students, members of our local and global
communities, *do to help others and ourselves heal from the various
experiences of loss from COVID?* In this devised piece, we aim to use
theatre, performance, and rituals to *remember and celebrate the lives of
those we‚Äôve lost to COVID*, while putting experiences of COVID and loss
from different cultures and communities in conversation with each other. [...]

Title: CASTING CALL for "Jackie & Sam" an URG Project
Creator: Grace Frome <GraceFrome2022@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
CASTING CALL
for
*"Jackie & Sam"*

A recorded table read of four eleven-minute webisodes.

An URG Project designed to make media that portrays an authentic lived
experience of neurodivergent children.

The episodes follow the day-to-day lives of sister and brother, Jackie (11)
and Sam (10), as they have local adventures and use their strengths to
solve problems. Both siblings have dyslexia and each have another common
learning difference. [...]

Title: Fall Remote Internship
Creator: Amanda Lowry <amandalowry2017@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi Wildcats!

White Horse Pictures is looking for remote fall interns. We're a film & TV
production company based in Los Angeles with mostly documentaries and
docu-series on our slate, but we also have a few narrative films & TV shows
in development.

We're currently nominated for 6 Emmys for the HBO documentary *THE BEE
GEES: HOW CAN YOU MEND A BROKEN HEART. *Last year, we also won an Emmy for
our documentary *THE APOLLO*, which was about the history of the Apollo
Theater in Harlem. Our main project at the moment is a documentary about
Lucille Ball, directed by [...]

Hey everyone,

Basically, you get to watch movies and tv shows, attend remarkable speaker
events where industry professionals oftentimes give you their emails or
other contact info to hit them up, and you get to connect with interns
around the world who are pursuing similar careers. How does that sound?

actively listened to and there's room to grow :) [...]

Title: Filmscape Chicago 2021 Registration Is Now Open!
Creator: Studio 22 Exec <studio22.exec@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Hey RTVF! Check out this message from alum, Ned McGregor! Register for Filmscape Chicago 2021!

‚Äì Studio 22 Exec

‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì

Filmscape Chicago 2021 Registration Is Now Open!

Join us for two days of completely free exhibitors, classes, and networking!

Hello, RTVF! Ned McGregor, '15 here. Since graduating I helped start Filmscape Chicago - we are an event focused on education for Chicago's film and TV community. We have our first event since the pandemic at the end of this month - August 28 & 29, at Cinespace Chicago. We have two full days of free classes, as well as an [...]

Title: CALL FOR SCRIPTS - DEADLINE EXTENDED

Description:
CALL FOR SCRIPTS

Applause for a Cause, Northwestern's philanthropic student film production
company, is seeking a feature-length script to produce during the 2021-2022
school year! Submit a script to us over the summer!

New Deadline: August 20th, 2021 at 11:59 PM***

REQUIREMENTS:

A screenplay, 60-120 pages in length

Logline and synopsis

All genres welcome*

writers should keep in mind the financial restrictions of a micro-budget
film as well as potential COVID-19 related restrictions (a smaller
cast/crew, etc). [...]

just 5-6 hours to film the ceremony and speeches/first dance at the
reception. Budget is max $1500.
Send me a note if you're available or if you know someone who might be!! [...]

Title: Call for Script Submissions!
Creator: Applause For a Cause <applausenu@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
CALL FOR SCRIPTS

Applause for a Cause, Northwestern's philanthropic student film production
company, is seeking a feature-length script to produce during the 2021-2022
school year! Submit a script to us over the summer!

Deadline: August 6th, 2020 at 11:59 PM***

REQUIREMENTS:

A screenplay, 60-120 pages in length

Logline and synopsis

All genres welcome*

*This is a student feature that will be filmed during winter quarter; thus,
writers should keep in mind the financial restrictions of a micro-budget
film as well as potential COVID-19 related restrictions (a smaller
cast/crew, etc). [...]

Title: "The Cage" is hiring.
Creator: Rachael Moeller <rachael@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description: The RTVF Equipment Resource Center, ‚ÄúThe Cage‚Äù, is hiring student workers for Fall 2021. The Cage circulates equipment for approximately 300 faculty, staff, and students in the department. Job duties include, but aren‚Äôt limited to, preparing reservations, checking orders out, returning items, and inventory. Ideal characteristic traits are attention to detail, good customer service, good communication skills, reliable nature, fast learner and worker, and good work ethic. Position does require bending, lifting, carrying, and moving around a good amount of weight repeatedly during a shift. Position is open to both work study and non-work study students. If you are interested [...]
