Title: Calling all aspiring screenwriters for PILOT! - a New Proposed Northwestern Organization
Creator: Nathaniel Unger <nathanielunger2023@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Calling all aspiring screenwriters!

Introducing Pilot! - A new proposed Northwestern student organization in which we'll simulate a writers' room and pitch, workshop, and write the screenplays for an entire television series in one quarter. Each literal "season" will culminate in a table reading of our pilot episode!


This organization does not exist yet, but we are currently looking for NU students to help us reach the required number of interested members in order to submit the new organization proposal form by Sunday, May 2nd. (We are also in search of a faculty advisor. We'd be incredibly grateful for an interested professor to join the team in a no-hassle role.)


It's going to be an awesome journey, and we can't wait to get started! If you are interested, please fill out ‚Äî> THIS <‚Äî form! All experience levels are equally invited to join.


If you have any questions at all, feel free to reach out to me (Nathaniel Unger, '23) at n.u@u.northwestern.edu.


See you in the fall!

Title: You're Invited: Reading of Iya-Ile (The First Wife) followed by a Q&A with the playwright, British-Nigerian playwright Oladipo Agboluaje

Description:
Dear Northwestern Community:
Please join us for a very special event ‚Äì a professional reading of Iya-Ile (The First Wife) by British-Nigerian playwright Oladipo Agboluaje, followed by a Q&A with the playwright co-moderated by Dean E. Patrick Johnson and Prof. Thomas Bradshaw.
The play is directed by Matthew Dada and stars Isoken V. Aiwerioba, Godsgift Dickson, Michael Fadairo, Beulah Obioma, Ade Otukoya, Faith Ridge, Wariboko Semenitari, and Keane Soluade, with stage directions read by Omoyemi Ajisebutu.

Title: ANNOUNCING: Multi Culti Executive Board Petitions
Creator: Hannah So <hannahso2022@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi RTVF,

The Multicultural Filmmakers Collective (MFC, Multi Culti) is holding
petitions next Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday for our 2021-2022 Executive
Board.

Who are we and what do we do?

Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is a student-run production company
that aims to provide an encouraging environment for the burgeoning
creativity of multicultural student filmmakers. The purpose of the
Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is to nurture, promote, and ally
multicultural student filmmakers at Northwestern University, as well as
support student films that present multicultural concerns and experiences.
We define multicultural as including, but not limited to, underrepresented
races, ethnicities, religions, genders, sexual orientations, [...]

Title: Spring Quarter and the library
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
RTVF Graduate Students,

Please see the update below from our University Library Media Librarian, Gina Petersen.

Hello,

Library services for Spring Quarter will remain what they were during Winter Quarter. For physical materials you can either pick them up at the library or have them mailed to you. More details are below.

Northwestern's Affordable Instructional Resources (AIR) group is accepting applications from faculty interested in developing Open Education Resources. Applications are due by March 26. For more information see: https://air.northwestern.edu/get-started/open-educational-resources/oer-faculty-grant.html [...]

Title: Remote Video Editing Internship with SAP [Paid]
Creator: Andrew Thomas <drewthomas@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hey RTVF!

SAP's Industry Value Chain team is looking for a remote intern to start in
early April and continue through August, with the opportunity to extend the
contract for a full year. During the academic year you would be expected to
work 10-15 hours a week, which would increase to full-time (40 hrs/wk) over
the summer. Your primary responsibilities would include video and podcast
editing, with some additional graphic design work, script writing, and
website maintenance through Microsoft Sharepoint. [...]

Title: Bechdel Screenplay Competition - WIN NUWFA MERCH

[image: NUWFA Contest.png]
Looking for a chance to write over Spring Break?

On *Thursday, March 25 at 6pm CST,* NUWFA will provide a prompt for
our *Bechdel
Screenplay Competition*. All participants will have *24 hours to write a
5-page screenplay that passes the Bechdel Test!*

To pass the Bechdel Test a screenplay must have two named female characters
who talk to each other about something other than a man. [...]

Title: Boomshaka Spring Show Videographer/Editor
Creator: Annika Amlie <annikaamlie2021@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Boomshaka is looking for someone to film and/or edit our spring
performance! We have been rehearsing for the past two quarters and would
love to have a video to send to friends, family, and alumni. We are
planning to film our show throughout the week of* April 18-25 *in Shanley
Pavilion. We are flexible with times and will work with your schedule. We
are hoping to have the videos edited soon after the dates mentioned above.
We will pay a videographer $500 (negotiable) and will pay more if you can
also edit. If you are just an editor, we will [...]

Title: SEEKING: Post Prod Crew for In the Woods Where They Go to Bury Things
Creator: Annika Weinberg <annikaweinberg2021@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
[image: cYDtw5np.gif]
[image: Z9VyPiVl.gif]
A Senior Directing Film
Written and Directed by Greg Voelkel
Produced by Shelby Schultz & Annika Weinberg

*LOGLINE: *Seeking release after a breakup, a young woman journeys into the
forest to rid herself of her heartache.

*SEEKING:*
Head Editor
Assistant Editors

Title: Spring Internship - NextGen Growth Partners
Creator: Funmilayo Ojikutu <funmilayo.ojikutu@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
NextGen Growth Partners is looking for a spring interns to assist with video production and editing.

With safety in mind, NextGen has been hosting all interns remotely, and has developed best practices for remote interviewing as well. This poses a unique challenge for interns to assist in remote creation while exploring a corporate narrative. Though much of their content is interview-based, NextGen is also looking for animators to help craft brief FAQ/introductory videos that can easily be shared in such a virtual world. [...]

Creator: NUWFA Exec <nuwomenfilm@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
*Hey everyone!*

*Announcing Petitions for the 2021-22*
*NUWFA Executive Board!*

*MISSION STATEMENT: *
The Northwestern University Women Filmmakers Alliance (NUWFA) seeks to
unify, educate, and promote filmmakers who identify as women, trans, and/or
gender-nonconforming within the Northwestern community and beyond. We
accomplish these goals by encouraging this community's involvement as
leaders in Radio/Television/Film at Northwestern and promoting the
development of visual media created by filmmakers excluded from the
structures of the film community. In addition to behind the scenes, NUWFA
also advocates for dynamic representations of women, trans, and/or
gender-nonconforming people on the screen. [...]

Title: ANNOUNCING: Deep End Comedy Writer Applications 2021-22
Creator: The Deep End <thedeepend.nu@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Hey RTVF!

Are you an aspiring comedy writer? Do you love political satire shows
like *Last
Week Tonight* or *Patriot Act*? Have you always wanted to be part of a
television writers‚Äô room? Well, that's too bad. Instead, you should apply
to be a writer for *The Deep End*, Northwestern‚Äôs comedy/journalism show!

The Deep End is a pre-taped show produced each quarter that exists at the
intersection of comedy and journalism. Each episode takes a deep dive into
a topical issue at Northwestern presented in a comedic monologue delivered
by a host. Comedy writers work alongside our team of journalists [...]

Title: CASTING CALL: Bubble (RTVF Sitcom Production Grant)
Creator: Julianna Lee <juliannalee2022@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
*CASTING CALL: Bubble*
An RTVF Sitcom Production Grant
Written by Liv Glassman
Directed by Hannah Lindvall
Produced by Julianna Lee

SERIES LOGLINE: It's a new school year for college feminist Eva and, even
though we're in a pandemic, she's excited to move into an off-campus
apartment with Leena and Joy. But, when her body-building and
not-so-feminist twin brother's fraternity disbands, Eva is forced to let

fratty best friends James and Walter. [...]

Title: Big/Little Mentorship Program
Creator: The Deep End <thedeepend.nu@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
[image: Profile Picture_1 (2).png]

*The Deep End* is creating a University-wide *mentorship program* to offer
an alternative to the mentorship and friendships created through Greek
Life! First years and second years (and transfers!) will take on the role
of *‚ÄúLittle‚Äù *and be mentored by an upperclassmen student, or *‚ÄúBig,‚Äù* with
similar interests and personalities. In keeping with Greek Life‚Äôs
superficiality, we also *guarantee that all mentees will be shorter than
their mentors.* [...]

Title: Virtual Premiere: Grief Night Club
Creator: Nolan Robinson <nolanrobinson2021@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi RTVF community!

Next Friday, February 12th at 7:30 pm is the virtual premiere of my short
film musical "Grief Night Club." It is FREE to watch but will only be
available for one weekend (until the 15th), and in order to access the link
and password you gotta RSVP here
<https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://www.eventbrite.com/e/grief-night-club-virtual-premiere-tickets-134578093701?utm-medium=discovery&utm-campaign=social&utm-content=attendeeshare&aff=escb&utm-source=cp&utm-term=listing__;!!Dq0X2DkFhyF93HkjWTBQKhk!DHeAPSVL_MGvqhwXgn9E2PK782RyLsKJJfEMx6Dobw2TfsQ2qHzdqYSKkrdoPtNmH7IvBtWsaAwv$ >
!!!

Premise: As a young man struggles through moments of uncertainty, grief,
mortality and being unable to cope with the influx of emotion, he is
brought along on a mental journey of self-discovery and self-worth through
a language that speaks even though he wishes to stay silent [...]

Title: Director + Producer Petitions BUBBLE
Creator: Liv Glassman <livglassman2022@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description: LOG LINE‚Äã: ‚ÄãIt‚Äôs a new school year for college feminist Eva and, even though we‚Äôre in a pandemic, she‚Äôs excited to move into an off-campus apartment with Leena and Joy. But, when her body-building and not-so-feminist twin brother‚Äôs fraternity disbands, Eva is forced to let Eli move into her spare bedroom and create a COVID-safe bubble with his fratty best friends James and Walter. Creator: Delaney McCallum <DelaneyMcCallum2021@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
[image: IMG_0786.jpg]
*Seeking Musical Composer for *
*My Women See Ghosts*
*A senior directing film *
Written/Directed/Animated by Delaney McCallum

LOG LINE
In this animated documentary, I investigate my relationship towards my
female family's predisposition for the supernatural.

LOOKING FOR
At this time, I'm seeking a musically talented individual to compose an
original score for the project (Remote).

*No prior experience in composition is necessary, but if you have previous
work I would love to hear it! Because this is an ongoing animated project,
I will need someone who is willing to work with me over the next two
quarters. [...]

Title: David Boykin: looking for collaborators to produce audio documentary
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
RTVF Students,

Please see the opportunity below.
* * *
Dear RTVF Community,

I would like to forward to you an invitation to participate in an artistic project led by esteemed Chicago-based musician David Boykin. David is looking for collaborators who might be interested in assisting him in the production of a one-hour (possibly biographical) audio documentary to be featured on the radio station Worldwide FM (https://worldwidefm.net/series/qc-radio/). Title: SEEKING: NUWFA Industry Co-Chair
Creator: Caroline Bates <carolinebates2023@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi RTVF!

Are you a first-year or transfer student interested in joining a film board? NUWFA is seeking an additional industry co-chair to work with our team in planning our winter speaker event!

So, what is NUWFA?
The Northwestern University Women Filmmakers Alliance seeks to unify, educate, and promote female, trans, and non-binary filmmakers not only within the Northwestern community, but also beyond the educational sphere. We accomplish these goals by encouraging womxn's involvement as leaders in the Radio/Television/Film community and promoting the development of visual media created by womxn filmmakers. In addition to behind the scenes, NUWFA also advocates [...]

Title: Applause Presents: The PREMIERE of We're the Marvels
Creator: Applause For a Cause <applausenu@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Applause for a Cause Presents:

The VIRTUAL PREMIERE of We‚Äôre the Marvels

The 2020 Applause for a Cause Feature Film

Benefiting the Howard Area Community Center

Written by Christian Ubillus

Directed by Tony Inhorn and Shelby Schultz

Produced by Grace Frome and Adam Present

A young woman prepares a Thanksgiving dinner for a group of friends as a
practice run before making actual Thanksgiving dinner for her family. As we
see the prep, the dinner, and the aftermath, out of order, we start to see
that she and her friends similarly struggle with feelings of over-reliance
on others - a [...]

Title: Remote Spring Internship Opportunity With Captivate!
Creator: Annika Weinberg <annikaweinberg2021@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hello!

If you are looking for a remote Spring internship, see the opportunity
below:

Captivate Entertainment LLC. is a production company founded by Jeffrey

[...]

Title: SEEKING Social Media Coordinator for Podcast on Relationship Abuse
Creator: Adam Joel <adamwjoel@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Hey everyone,

I'm an alum who's now one of the producers on *Love is Not
<https://urldefense.com/v3/__http://www.loveisnot.org__;!!Dq0X2DkFhyF93HkjWTBQKhk!BZXJCtd7sVQbLGkarb5PJcbLZ107_QP7jrOrbz1Kc1rxetO4rldxYj6BSMqGes-hXx-xfjRq4z1a$ >,* the (surprisingly funny) podcast about
relationship abuse!

We're looking for a social media coordinator to join our team so let me
know if this sounds interesting to you:

*About the Podcast*
The Host of *Love is Not
<https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-32ijK4y69qHi2cJTNM2z9g8LRWF-EAQ/view?usp=sharing__;!!Dq0X2DkFhyF93HkjWTBQKhk!BZXJCtd7sVQbLGkarb5PJcbLZ107_QP7jrOrbz1Kc1rxetO4rldxYj6BSMqGes-hXx-xfvB4WQL5$ >*,
Sydney Bauer, brings together friends, fellow survivors (like me!), and
experts to heal from relationship abuse in its many shapes and sizes and
explore how to build healthier relationships in the future. Together, we
learn what love is, by discussing what love is not. [...]

Title: MultiCulti Presents: "Cadaver" Teleparty Screening
Creator: Multi Culti <nu.multiculti@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Join MFC for a virtual, spooky screening of the new Netflix original,
"Cadaver," this *Thursday, October 29th at 8 PM. *

*SYNOPSIS:* In the aftermath of a nuclear disaster, a starving family finds
hope in a charismatic hotel owner. Lured by the prospect of a free dinner,
they discover that the evening's entertainment blurs the lines between
performance and reality. Will they wind up the spectators or become the
spectacle? [...]

Title: Remote Internship Opportunity
Creator: Amanda Lowry <amandalowry2017@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi Wildcats!

The film & television production company in Beverly Hills where I work,
White Horse Pictures, is looking for 1 or 2 more fall interns to start
ASAP.

We largely do feature-length music and pop culture documentaries (we just
won an Emmy for *The Apollo* on HBO; last year we produced Ron Howard's
*Pavarotti*), and our main project this quarter is a documentary on Lucille
Ball directed by Amy Poehler. But we're also developing several narrative
TV & film projects, if that's the space you're more interested in. [...]

Title: Remote Fall Internship Opportunity!!
Creator: Sydney Yockey <sydneyyockey2020@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Looking for a fall internship? Check out the opportunity below!

Captivate Entertainment (the producers of the Jason Bourne franchise) is a
production company with a first look deal at Universal Studios based on the
Universal lot. Duties include script and book reading and coverage,
research projects, and general office duties. Great opportunity for a
crash-course in story and development for aspiring producers,
screenwriters, and directors. Internship requirements: Currently enrolled
in undergrad or graduate program. Candidates must receive school credit for
the internship.**Because of the Covid-19 pandemic, interns for fall 2020
will be working remotely. If interested, please email resume to
[...]

Description:
ANNOUNCING:

Casting Call

for

I GOT NEXT

A young basketball player navigates adolescence, family, and masculinity
while proving himself to his dominating older brother.

Drama. 10 minutes.

A Media Arts Grant Film

Written and Directed by Dhruv Mehra

Produced by Conor Metz

Shooting 2nd Weekend Fall 2020

September 24-27, 2020

Role Descriptions

Miles

14-17, male. White, Asian, or Mixed Race. Highly skilled basketball player.
Struggling to express any vulnerability. Seeking his brother‚Äôs validation. [...]

Title: ANNOUNCING: BIPOC MENTORSHIP PROGRAM
Creator: Multi Culti <nu.multiculti@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Hello all!

RTVF alums Lizzie Frieder ('17) and Carly Kleinbart ('16) started a
mentorship program and want to share info about their initiative with the
RTVF community.

-----

BIPOC Next Gen Mentorship Program in association with Women Wednesday: The
BIPOC Next Gen Mentorship Program in association with Women Wednesday seeks
to bolster Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPOC) in the
decision-making rooms of our industry. We want to focus on the people who
will one day make the decision about who gets to make their art: the
executives, producers, agents, and managers in film, television, and
theater. We will [...]

Title: Congratulations to Screen Cultures' Whitney Pow
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
RTVF Community,

Please see the announcement below.

Congratulations to Whitney Pow who successfully defended their dissertation, ‚ÄúStored in Memory: Queer and Transgender Life in Software History.‚Äù It is a remarkable and innovative contribution that reorients game/computational studies toward trans lives, bodies, and game designers. It is also a wonderful addition to archive and memory studies. Whitney has already published excerpts, and it is now being solicited for book publication. Whitney will be joining the NYU faculty in Fall as a Tenure Track Assistant Professor. Thank you to Jan Radway and Patrick Jagoda (U of Chicago) who served as members of [...]

Hello RTVF Community! Hope you‚Äôre doing well and staying safe during this virtual spring quarter.

I‚Äôm RTVF Class of 2011 and Kellogg MBA Class of 2020. unaligned AI.*

Title: Summer Internship (WFH!) at Captivate Entertainment in Los Angeles
Creator: a.docksey@u.northwestern.edu <adamdocksey2007@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi guys,

Posting this below from my company. Please submit your resumes or questions
about the internship to summer2020interns@gmail.com. This is an opportunity
best suited to rising seniors and juniors.
Note: While it's not required that Brian Perkinson likes you, it really
helps.

Captivate Entertainment (the producers of the Jason Bourne franchise) is a
production company with a first look deal at Universal Studios based on the
Universal lot. Duties include script and book reading and coverage,
research projects, and general office duties. Great opportunity for a
crash-course in story and development for aspiring producers,
screenwriters, and directors. Internship requirements: [...]

Title: ANNOUNCING: Multicultural Filmmakers Collective Board Petitions
Creator: Multi Culti <nu.multiculti@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
[image: MultiCultiPetitions-01.jpg]
RTVF,

The Multicultural Filmmakers Collective (MFC, Multi Culti) is holding
petitions starting *next weekend* (4/18-19) for our 2020-2021 Executive
Board.

Who are we and what do we do?

Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is a student-run production company
that aims to provide an encouraging environment for the burgeoning
creativity of multicultural student filmmakers. The purpose of the
Multicultural Filmmakers Collective is to nurture, promote, and ally
multicultural student filmmakers at Northwestern University, as well as
support student films that present multicultural concerns and experiences.
We define multicultural as including, but not limited to, underrepresented
races, ethnicities, religions, genders, sexual orientations, [...]

Title: SEEKING DIRECTOR: Advanced Directing Sequence
Creator: Rey Tang <reytang2021@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi everyone

I'm looking for a rising Senior interested in applying for the Advanced
Directing Sequence 2020-21. I wrote a screenplay and am looking for someone
to help bring it to life.

*TITLE*: *RUBATO*

*LOGLINE:* In 2049, after 14-year-old Katz discovers music for the first
time with his best friend Nat, Nat is reported to the government and goes
missing. After a month, Katz must piece together what had happened, as well
as find something new to believe in. [...]

Title: [BUMP] THIS FRIDAY: Writing and Performing Stand-Up Showcase
Creator: Hope Rehak <hoperehak2017@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hi RTVF community,

For those of you on campus today, this final stand-up showcase *will go on*
this evening at 6 in the AMS Auditorium.

Per Northwestern guidelines, we will limit the audience to 35-40 people
max, in a room with a capacity of 144. With the student performers, that is
28% capacity, and does not meet the criteria of a large gathering in a
limited space. Student performers are opting in or out of live performance
based on their own needs. We expect all community members present to
practice social distancing encouraged by Northwestern administration.
Clorox wipes and hand [...]

Description:
Hi all,

Sending this again and noting that it is PAID! Therese will be happy to
discuss a reasonable rate with anyone interested.

Here are the details:

Therese Harrold, a Chicago native, is seeking two filmmakers skilled in
cinematography and/or editing to help with her latest project, *Conceal and
Carry, *a story about race, culture, and class colliding when an unemployed

and Loyola Universities, Therese majored in Communication Arts: Speech and
Drama and Secondary Education. As a play [...]

Title: Petition for the 2020-2021 NUWFA Exec Board!
Creator: NUWFA Exec <nuwomenfilm@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
*PETITION FOR THE 2020-2021*

*NUWFA EXECUTIVE BOARD!*

MISSION STATEMENT:

The Northwestern Women Filmmakers Alliance (NUWFA) seeks to unify, educate,
and promote filmmakers who identify as women, trans, and/or
gender-nonconforming within the Northwestern community, and beyond. We
accomplish these goals by encouraging this community's involvement as
leaders in Radio/Television/Film at Northwestern and promoting the
development of visual media created by filmmakers excluded from the
structures of the patriarchal film community. In addition to behind the
scenes, NUWFA also advocates for dynamic representations of women, trans,

to get some experience!
Let me know if you're interested!
Best,
Jenna

Description:
Hello Students,

Description:

cinematography and/or editing to help with her latest project, *Conceal and

alumnae of [...]

Title: ANNOUNCING: Crew Petitions for ODB!

Title: Crew Petitions for Graduate Film - SKIN
Creator: Ray Goldberg <RayGoldberg2020@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
*SKIN*
Written & Executive Produced by Ray Goldberg
Directed by Charlotte Adams
Produced by Eric Seth

*Estranged sisters Lindsay and Jess agree to a homemade dinner to talk
things over and make up, but it's tough to reconcile when you're each
other's best friend and worst enemy.*

This 10-minute film is being produced through the MFA in Writing for the
Screen + Stage program. Right now we're still in the early stages of
pre-production. We'll be shooting in the north Chicago neighborhood of
Rogers Park. The 2-day shoot will take place in the spring quarter, but we
haven't yet set [...]

Creator: Anna Cohen <annacohen2021@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description: When I read this casting email, tears filled my special maroon eyes. To see women reduced to a list of physical features that are unrealistic, to see the pairing of whiteness with beauty (perpetuating racist beauty standards), and to see complete disregard for characterization was so completely disappointing. I don‚Äôt know who wrote this description but if they‚Äôd like a NUWFA workshop on writing real women, lmk. Carnivorously, Anna P.S. Title: Re: Casting Call for VITA
Creator: Rey Tang <reytang2021@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
I'd like to second these previous comments.

I think these character descriptions were written solely with physical
attributes - characteristics which, in my mind, foster both unhealthy and
unrealistic beauty standards. Furthermore, as we learn more about creating
dynamic and well-rounded characters through our years of academia, I guess
it's a little disheartening to see an email enter the listserv which
grounds women solely on these out-dated conceptions of beauty/sexual
desire. It's even more difficult to grapple with when I realize that it
came from an all-female crew, as these callous descriptions read more like
the stereotypical writings from cis-het [...]

Title: RTVF: Dialogues on Queerness
Creator: Rey Tang <reytang2021@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hey Friends

Calling queer folks of all backgrounds! Ever think about LGBTQ+ issues
within the RTVF Community?

Come through to our first ever Dialogue on Queerness! In an open classroom
with *FREE PIZZA.* Come chat with fellow queer film students and bond!

[image: 83725583_3645299215510069_8143561385410822144_n.jpg]

Hosted by MultiCulti and URSA!

Best,
*Rey Tang *(She/Her/Hers)

Title: CREW MEMBER OPP: Survivor - Northwestern - 'CATS COLLIDE!
Creator: Chase Reed <chasereed2020@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Survivor: Northwestern is currently seeking *associate producers* and *camera
operators* for the Winter-Spring 2020 season! **Freshmen RTVF majors
encouraged to apply!**[image:
70702417_1191858784351520_3468194140288712704_o.jpg]

- *Associate producers* will assist in challenge conception,
construction, and implementation; will plan out twists; and assist in
coordinating contestant schedules. Occasionally may assist (if available)
with camera operation.
- *Camera operators* will film all immunity challenges and tribal
councils. You won't need to know how to work with any specialty equipment -
we'll just be filming on our phones. [...]

Title: ANNOUNCING: The Full Crew of The NJB Project!
Creator: Paula Miller <paulamiller2020@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Announcing the Full Crew of:
[image: logo.jpg]

A Media Arts Grant Web Series

Directed and Written by Paula Miller and Sarah Evans

In the week leading up to Yom Kippur, four Jewish best friends and
roommates struggle with their love lives and relationships. As they
navigate budding romances and dating mishaps, each of them re-examines what
it means to be Jewish in today's world. [...]

Title: [Job Opp] Come work at MassVR!
Creator: URSA <ursa@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
*Contact Michaela **Puscas **<mpuscas@massvr.com <mpuscas@massvr.com>> for
more details!*
*URSA*
---

We would like to invite the Radio/Television/Film Student Association at
Northwestern to apply to work as a shoutcaster at MassVR. Send your resume
to hiring@massvr.com

*Position Overview:*

The Shoutcaster is a broadcast personality who creates energetic content
for live broadcasts and streams. Informative, strategic, and humorous,
Shoutcasters provide analysis and commentary across platforms such as
Twitch, Facebook Live and Intagram Live. The ideal candidate is a
Personality who is more than comfortable in front of a camera, is
well-spoken and is able to cast individually and as a team. [...]

Title: The Daily Northwestern Recruitment
Creator: URSA <ursa@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description: *Forwarding from The Daily. Contact Chris for more details!* *URSA* -- Hi all! I'm Chris Vazquez. Title: IMPACT PRODUCTION INTERNSHIP @ Chicago documentary org. Kindling Group
Creator: Adam Joel <adamjoel2018@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hey,

Want to learn how to distribute impactful films WITHOUT making a festival
run?

I graduated from NU thinking that festivals were the only option for film
distribution, but then this internship showed me new ways that any film
with a good cause can reach a massive audience. I'm an NU alum who found
meaningful work at the nonprofit documentary org, Kindling Group. *We're
seeking a new Impact Production / Community Engagement intern for a cool
film about early childhood education called No Small Matter
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.nosmallmatter.com_&d=DwIBaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=9uvVDPcHJoe-u_t0ZKOZIF1sSKYkn21vh_GiP7XBZ3U&s=7I2ILbgsvymNW9CGMPN7DPT9vymKp637D-Jp4WzARGk&e= >.* [...]

Title: Internship Opportunities - Chicago Latino Film Festival
Creator: Maria Valencia <mariavalencia2020@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description: Hey all! I'm passing along this internship information from RTVF 2017 alum Sophie Gordon: "The Chicago Latino Film Festival is looking for interns to start in January in preparation for the Festival in April! About the Festival: The Chicago Latino Film Festival is the largest, most comprehensive, and best Latino festival in the United States. Our mission is to share with our audience short and feature films of great quality that represent the thematic diversity of cinema from Latin America, Spain, Portugal, and the United States. The internship positions we are looking to fill: *Graphic design: *Designing and creating digital [...]

Title: New Shack Laugh Track - Vertigo
Creator: Jake Curtis <jakecurtis2020@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Are you a standup comic or interested in giving stand-up comedy a try? Have
new jokes? Need a crowd to try them out on? Look no further than...
New Shack Laugh Track
A Vertigo Productions special event aiming to give standup comics an
opportunity to try and test out new material.

*Time: Fri. 1/17, 1/18 @ 9pm*
*Location: Shanley Pavilion*
Email anthonyroytman2021@u.northwestern.edu if you are interested in
performing or have any questions!

Title: Fisk Closing for Winter Break
Creator: David Lynch <david-lynch@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hello Students,

The Fisk Lab will close at 3:00pm on Friday, December 13 for the winter break. All data on the computers n Fisk Lab will be deleted over the break. The lab will re-open on 1/6/20 for the first day of classes winter quarter.

Have a great break!

-david

Title: The Max Saines Summer Internship at Endeavor Content
Creator: Laura Myers <laura-myers@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description: Hello RTVF community! I have an amazing internship opportunity to tell you about below. This internship will take place at Endeavor Content in Beverly Hills, CA, but Northwestern Career Advancement is listed as the employer since this is exclusively for Northwestern students and I am managing any questions you may have. However, Endeavor Content will manage the interview process and make all hiring decisions. While the program is open to all years, current juniors and seniors are preferred. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out. [...]

<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.facebook.com_events_891912747871061_&d=DwIBaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=viiwNF5KyG5yYoGBE7EEThwlwC4aUUVA18SPhjZBdeI&s=NkrM3xUyNDL982c_6kYZdCWA3VSF0SZTbXSsU0xi3E4&e= >

Creator: Paula Miller <paulamiller2020@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Paid videographer opportunity!

*AHANA Dance Project* is a Bollywood Fusion dance group on campus looking

Looking for a 1.5 minute video and can provide compensation for
filming/editing!

Please reach out to ahanadanceproject@gmail.com if you are interested -
they will be happy to provide details.

Title: New RTVF Department Admin Listserv
Creator: Patrick Lile <p-lile@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description: To better disseminate information to RTVF students, the department has created a new listserv (rtvf-admin@listerserv.it.northwestern.edu<mailto:rtvf-admin@listerserv.it.northwestern.edu>). The new listserv aims to provide information about the department, including events, deadlines, grant opportunities, and registration. The new listserv will not have a ‚Äúreply all‚Äù function, but students with questions about anything distributed through the listserv will be able to respond directly to the message sender. [...]

Title: OPEN CALL FOR CORI - NEUTRAL GOOD
Creator: Hwa Kang <hwakang2020@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Northwestern Senior Directing Film

Written and Directed by Mega Dafiaghor

Produced by Renee Grotthuss and Hannah So

Shooting 2nd and 3rd weekends of Winter Quarter:

January 17th-19th and 24th-26th

LOGLINE:

An anally retentive woman enlists the help of her reckless neighbor

to have the craziest birthday of her life.

CHARACTER DESCRIPTION:

CORI (mid 20s, open ethnicity) - Cori has always been a rule follower, but
she wants to change to live what she imagines is a more fulfilling life.
She cooks up a scheme to blackmail her neighbor into helping her party.
Works as an ASL translator. [...]

Title: FREE Test Screening and Talkback with Producer!
Creator: Studio 22 Exec <studio22.exec@GMAIL.COM>
Description: [image: NewcityScreening.jpg] <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.facebook.com_events_736736666846131_&d=DwIFaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=AjfGAMFA0fZtIUuKFf_0hBdBpXzjrcXsxsiDgUPAoP8&s=8xRrijPhIBRInKLhNsYeDbMYX01-eFPVhr6iRT1A4zA&e= > *FREE SCREENING, FREE PIZZA, FREE TALKBACK* Studio 22 presents a test screening of Newcity's 2020 film, "Dreaming Grand Avenue." A talkback with the producer will follow the screening, and Newcity wants your feedback! Dreaming Grand Avenue is an unreleased film from Newcity‚Äôs Chicago Film Project, producers of the upcoming film Knives and Skin. "Dreaming Grandd Avenue" is a drama about two strangers that keep meeting in their dreams, and the unresolved losses that keep them from realizing them. Starring Jackson Rathbone (Twilight) and Andrea Londo (Narcos). *The event <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.facebook.com_events_736736666846131_&d=DwIFaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=AjfGAMFA0fZtIUuKFf_0hBdBpXzjrcXsxsiDgUPAoP8&s=8xRrijPhIBRInKLhNsYeDbMYX01-eFPVhr6iRT1A4zA&e= > will take place in Louis 119 [...]

Hi all!

Title: Evanston Social Enterprise // Videography & Editing Job
Creator: Robinson Markus <robinson.markus@EVANSTON.COOP>
Description:
Dear RTVF students,

Happy November!

I'm an RTVF grad from the Class of '19, currently working for a social
enterprise that I co-founded that builds environmentally sustainable
backyard homes in Evanston with a local workforce - the Evanston
Development Cooperative: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__evanston.coop_&d=DwIBaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=0fNmcYzUSw7XRK7s2d1UgiPIMK03v7ifUOhwVNCGFQ8&s=duQHwH33uZ68LG5WZUMZtls9ZPQ1RCtSJJgkiHOmCZw&e=
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__evanston.coop_&d=DwIBaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=0fNmcYzUSw7XRK7s2d1UgiPIMK03v7ifUOhwVNCGFQ8&s=duQHwH33uZ68LG5WZUMZtls9ZPQ1RCtSJJgkiHOmCZw&e= >

We seek a student (or two, if you prefer) to shoot and edit two similar
videos as part of our "Evanston's Backyard Stories" storytelling
initiative. This would be paid work out of our marketing budget, and we can
discuss an appropriate rate for interested students based on the scope of
work for the project. [...]

Title: Remote Internship Opportunity
Creator: Sydney Yockey <sydneyyockey2020@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
*Safehouse Pictures in LA is looking for student script readers. *This
would serve as a remote internship for those interested in film and
television.

The company would provide a few scripts a week (or whatever you are
comfortable with), and you will have 48 hours to return a page synopsis and
analysis. This is currently an unpaid internship, but a great
opportunity to learn about story structure and some of the big names in
screenwriting. [...]

Title: RTVF Town Hall MINUTES
Creator: URSA <ursa@u.northwestern.edu>
Description:
Hello RTVF!

Attached are the minutes from last week's Town Hall, which includes
comments from students in the room, Deb and Spencer representing the
department, and student survey responses. The minutes themselves are
loooong, but here's the highlights!

- *Courses *New sections of Cinematography, Editing, Sound, Writing, and
Directing classes are being added starting next quarter (see minutes for
exact course numbers)
- *Workshops *New equipment workshops are being added to allow students
access to advanced equipment before needing to take advanced classes.
- *Printing *The financial burden of printing for classes is being
addressed, but professors need to be [...]

Title: THURSDAY 3:30pm - Artist Talk on Radio, Storytelling, and Dance
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@northwestern.edu>
Description:
Artist Talk with Eleanor McDowall

A discussion between Sarah Geis and Eleanor McDowall on radio, storytelling and dance

Thursday, 11/14

3:30 - 5PM

1877 Campus Drive
John J. Louis Hall, Room 105

Eleanor McDowall is a Director at Falling Tree Productions. She is the series producer of BBC Radio 4's Short Cuts, which won the Gold Award for Best Radio Podcast at the British Podcast Awards in both 2017 and 2018. Her documentary work has received the Prix Europa, the Whicker's World Foundation 'Audio Recognition Award' twice, a Third Coast award and the Gold Award for Best Factual Storytelling at [...]

Title: URAP RTVF positions to forward onto RTVF undergrad listserv
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@northwestern.edu>
Description:
Dear RTVF Students,

Two RTVF professors have research assistant positions for undergraduate‚Äôs available for application this year, deadline to apply to Monday November 18th, 2019 at 11:59pm!!!!

- Kyle Henry‚Äôs Trace of Time research/edit assistant

https://undergradresearch.northwestern.edu/open-positions-undergraduate-research-assistant-program-urap#Henry

- Spencer Parson‚Äôs Feature Film Workshopping dramaturg/assistant

https://undergradresearch.northwestern.edu/open-positions-undergraduate-research-assistant-program-urap#Parsons

The Undergraduate Research Assistant Program (URAP) is designed to help students of all disciplines get started in research! This program pairs students who are new to research with faculty mentors who are in need of assistance on their own research projects. In doing so, students who do not have sufficient research experience to design and carry [...]

Title: Fall SLUG (Sound Studies Listening Group) Session - THIS THURS, Nov 7, 4:30, in the Frances Searle Building Sound Tank
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@northwestern.edu>
Description:
THIS THURSDAY!!

The Sound Studies Listening Group (SSLG) ‚Äì a group of sound-minded Northwestern students and faculty ‚Äì invites you to the Fall 2019 session on Early Digital Synthesis led by Alex Inglizian.

In the early 1960s, the first digitally-produced sounds gave pioneering composers from around the world a taste of vast new possibilities. We will listen to recordings from some of the most influential composers of this era working in the realm of digital synthesis, and discuss the ideas and techniques that still continue to have an impact on modern music today. [...]

Title: Coming to Block Cinema This Thursday and Friday, Filmmaker Brett Story!
Creator: Patrick Lile <p-lile@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
The Block welcomes Toronto-based filmmaker Brett Story for two nights of her acclaimed documentary films.

[https://www.blockmuseum.northwestern.edu/cinema/2019/untitled-design-39.png]

Thursday, November 7th - 7 PM ‚Äì The Prison in Twelve Landscapes

The Prison in Twelve Landscapes explores the criminal justice system and mass incarceration in the U.S. from a number of oblique vantage points, rather than focusing on prisons themselves. Story looks at female prisoners used as labor to fight California wildfires, a Bronx, New York warehouse for prisoner care packages, a rural coal town anticipating jobs at a new prison, and Ferguson, Missouri, where Michael Brown was killed. Throughout, Story connects the [...]

Title: Special Edition Spooky Writers Circle TONIGHT!
Creator: Studio 22 Exec <studio22.exec@GMAIL.COM>
Description: Join us tonight for a Spooky Writers Seance *Kresge 2319 | 5:00pm* [image: spookywriterscircle.jpg] <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.facebook.com_events_543547356445778_&d=DwIFaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=B6nx3O0O1_LoYSmSdyqbSAtsLaSIHBk_KCVkPo8olA4&s=NBi0rYBQvKyGQpqjj1bVTInDfzWZgeuYrsdj5jPZNkQ&e= > Come spill the scary stories your great aunt told you and brainstorm how to make a script out of them! You don't need to have been to a Writers Circle before, and you don't need a script ‚Äî come to talk about horror and read/write with us! *See you there! Title: ANNOUNCING: Full Crew of "We're the Marvels" - Applause Feature Film
Creator: Applause For a Cause <applausenu@GMAIL.COM>
Description: ANNOUNCING: THE FULL CREW OF... The 2019-20 Applause for a Cause Feature Film Benefiting the Howard Area Community Center Written by Christian Ubillus Directed by Tony Inhorn and Shelby Schultz Produced by Grace Frome and Adam Present A young woman prepares a Thanksgiving dinner for a group of friends as a practice run before making actual Thanksgiving dinner for her family. As we see the prep, the dinner, and the aftermath, out of order, we start to see that she and her friends similarly struggle with feelings of over-reliance on others - a feeling that‚Äôs just waiting to burst. Shooting: [...]

Title: Monday, Nov. 4: Poetry and the Commonplace: Podcasts as Public Address
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Poetry and the Commonplace: Podcasts as Public Address
Monday, Nov. 4th, 2-3:30pm, Hagstrum Room (University Hall 201)

Award-winning poet, sound artist, and podcast host Rachel Zucker will present and discuss her work at the intersection of poetry and Media Studies, specifically her podcast Commonplace: Conversations with Poets (and Other People) and her most recent poetry collection (and immersive audio project) SoundMachine. Zucker will present her work and engage in conversation with Neil Verma, Assistant Professor of sound studies in the Department of Radio/Television/Film. Topics to be discussed include the relationship between the written and spoken word, the podcast as genre, [...]

Title: Inclusion Discussion: Stacy Smith and Making Hollywood More Inclusive
Creator: URSA <ursa@u.northwestern.edu>
Description: From the Chicago International Film Festival: Hello! It is week 2 of the Chicago International Film Festival <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__chicagofilmfestival.com_festival_&d=DwIFaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=_3m8PLTNe5nKVSISmvrnPx2Pu32BSDNxhEuRAMP_K_U&s=EkDvi7QSaqETrZ3ZGBzYUfQnek5_bnACmuTfi-I9U98&e= > and we have some exciting events lined up for this weekend. In particular, we have an inclusion discussion scheduled this Sunday that I think would be of particular interest to the members of your organization. We are pleased to welcome *Dr. Stacy Smith* to discuss inclusion and diversity in the entertainment industry as part of our Women in Cinema program. Join us as she shares her research and insights into the under-representation of women in Hollywood‚Äîboth behind- the-camera and in film [...]

Title: MAG 2019-20 Decisions
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Dear Filmmaker,

I am writing to inform you that your project was not selected as a recipient for a Fall 2019 Large MAG award. I know this is disappointing news, but please know that the faculty values all of the work done in the department. The competition for the awards is very stiff, and many very worthy projects were not selected. We will continue to try to secure additional funding for student films, so that we can support as many of these projects as possible. If one of the current grant recipients receives a grant from a student group, then [...]

Title: The Blackout's Quarter Update Anchor Auditions!
Creator: Kinsey Jasnoch <kinseyjasnoch2021@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hey everyone!

It's that time of the quarter again, by which we of course mean mid. And
when it's midquarter, it's time for midquarter update.

We're doing auditions a little differently this year. We need TWO anchors
who can read, understand, and deliver jokes and also who seem like they've
met each other before!
Therefore, we will be hosting *PAIRS AUDITIONS* (like *High School Musical)*
!
If you're already in The Blackout, just stay after the meeting on Monday.
If you won't be at the meeting but still want to audition, come to *MCTRIB
3127 on Monday at 8:45*!
Here's [...]

Description:
Sign up for the NUWFA Mentorship program!
The NUWFA Mentorship program pairs underclassmen with an upperclassmen
based on their areas of interest. Pairs will meet informally over the
course of the year to ask questions, give general advice, and get to know
people across class boundaries!

You do not need to be an RTVF major, just part of the RTVF community!
This program is open to anyone who identifies as a woman or as part of the
larger LGBTQ+ community to act as a support system for underrepresented
gender identities in film. [...]

Title: GRIP TRAINING this Wednesday!
Creator: Studio 22 Exec <studio22.exec@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
[image: grip_training.jpg]
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.facebook.com_events_774055889709141_&d=DwIBaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=wQsTx9iVLknM7ntPdw0zsUav4jCsesnoXHrrp8xf-EY&s=pZLNQqmqEV2S6hllTE0MaHiDBDYmBs6r_PyZx3MJxaA&e= >

*Come learn the ins and outs of the equipment, lingo, and practices you'll
find on Northwestern film sets!*
Stands, lights, frames, clamps, electrics -- everything you need to know
about NU film sets will be covered here.

*RSVP to the Facebook event here!
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.facebook.com_events_774055889709141_&d=DwIBaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=wQsTx9iVLknM7ntPdw0zsUav4jCsesnoXHrrp8xf-EY&s=pZLNQqmqEV2S6hllTE0MaHiDBDYmBs6r_PyZx3MJxaA&e= >*

On set, grips typically help the camera and electric departments set up
equipment for each shot. This is a great way to learn a lot and be an
essential crew member on any film set. Whether you want to be prepared for
your first set or you're looking to review some [...]

Title: ANNOUNCING: Gen Crew Petitions for "We're the Marvels" - Applause Feature Film
Creator: Applause For a Cause <applausenu@GMAIL.COM>
Description: ANNOUNCING: GEN CREW PETITIONS FOR... The 2019-20 Applause for a Cause Feature Film Benefiting the Howard Area Community Center Written by Christian Ubillus Directed by Tony Inhorn and Shelby Schultz Produced by Grace Frome and Adam Present A young woman prepares a Thanksgiving dinner for a group of friends as a practice run before making actual Thanksgiving dinner for her family. As we see the prep, the dinner, and the aftermath, out of order, we start to see that she and her friends similarly struggle with feelings of over-reliance on others - a feeling that‚Äôs just waiting to burst. Shooting: [...]

WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 16 ‚Ä¢ 7PM ‚Ä¢ FREE

SISTERS IN CINEMA
with filmmaker Yvonne Welbon (PhD, 2001) in person!

To inaugurate a year of programming around the One Book One Northwestern 2019-2020 selection, Hidden Figures: The Untold True Story of Four African-American Women who Helped Launch Our Nation Into Space, Block Cinema welcomes Chicago-based filmmaker (and Northwestern Film Studies PhD) Yvonne Welbon to present her 2003 documentary Sisters in Cinema. Title: IMPACT PRODUCTION INTERNSHIP @ Chicago documentary org. Kindling Group
Creator: Adam Joel <adamjoel2018@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hey,

Want to learn how to distribute impactful films WITHOUT making a festival
run?

I graduated from NU thinking that festivals were the only option for film
distribution, but then this internship showed me new ways that any film
with a good cause can reach a massive audience. I'm an NU alum who found
meaningful work at the nonprofit documentary org, Kindling Group. *We're
seeking a new Impact Production / Community Engagement intern for a cool
film about early childhood education called No Small Matter

Title: THIS THURSDAY: SAG-AFTRA Q&A and Budget Filmmaking Tips
Creator: Studio 22 Exec <studio22.exec@GMAIL.COM>
Description: [image: films-on-a-budget.jpg] *RSVP to the Facebook event here! <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.facebook.com_events_565827637556748_&d=DwIFaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=cGNiCBZTy9EYPX2AkSMrzjb-b4_R4L9zPFiGnp20SL4&s=yQTyRQH3AFaOrvrC99_8steqVZyjih3T5pDfCNgXhzY&e= > * Presentation and talk back with Sanaa Sayyed, a business representative in the TV/Theatrical Department at SAG-AFTRA. Learn exactly what the Screen Actors Guild is all about, debunk the ‚Äúscariness‚Äù of contracts, and ask any and all questions you may have about filmmaking. Following the presentation and talk back with Sanaa, there will be time to ask Meezahn Senbetta, Studio 22‚Äôs Film Manager, any and all questions about the S22 Production Handbook. Check out the S22 Production Handbook here! <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__static1.squarespace.com_static_54d2ab1fe4b08b02e24e3f3a_t_5ce81f67971a18614dee5813_1558716266909_ProductionHandbookDraft6.pdf-3Ffbclid-3DIwAR2JaM3IvqgUeiCQYgl0rO9KhoFpK3hwt5DVlJtP-2DFUOpdJjxC7D4maRzsk&d=DwIFaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=cGNiCBZTy9EYPX2AkSMrzjb-b4_R4L9zPFiGnp20SL4&s=P95LTkGRqQ6C6JkjTjANPiIx0t4LrMMzEIZV15IceBg&e= > -- [image: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.facebook.com_studio22nu_&d=DwIFaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=cGNiCBZTy9EYPX2AkSMrzjb-b4_R4L9zPFiGnp20SL4&s=7hG512T4mPVAJU7IO5bpVdhO42nDFF0_FoaTLDZQMLI&e= ] <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.facebook.com_studio22nu_&d=DwIFaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=cGNiCBZTy9EYPX2AkSMrzjb-b4_R4L9zPFiGnp20SL4&s=7hG512T4mPVAJU7IO5bpVdhO42nDFF0_FoaTLDZQMLI&e= > <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3A__studio22nu.com_&d=DwIFaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=cGNiCBZTy9EYPX2AkSMrzjb-b4_R4L9zPFiGnp20SL4&s=Zan_z3RPH59Ew289KSXAykDUazhuQivtJvmcM6c8Qws&e= > <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.instagram.com_studio22-5Fnu_&d=DwIFaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=cGNiCBZTy9EYPX2AkSMrzjb-b4_R4L9zPFiGnp20SL4&s=MXpdMr6T08KdCFSoOQYK84H-f1nqtbsRXmzSvQczfQc&e= [...]

Title: Audition for Meeow $$$
Creator: Jake Curtis <jakecurtis2020@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description: Hey Friends, Auditions for Meeow are coming up on Monday and Tuesday. You should come. Come audition. Good times. Meeow is a sketch and improv group and we do two big shows every Winter with a full band and lots of people blacking out in the audience. It‚Äôs great. Auditions are only 15 minutes and we‚Äôre really looking for a range of new people this year. And also it‚Äôs 15 minutes so why not? And if you‚Äôre not that big into improv - doesn‚Äôt matter. Being in the group is like 90% writing. Party time! Yours sincerely, Jake https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.facebook.com_events_513741569189990_-3Fevent-5Ftime-5Fid-3D513741575856656&d=DwIFaQ&c=yHlS04HhBraes5BQ9ueu5zKhE7rtNXt_d012z2PA6ws&r=htaZELiGCcF0UuIzVp3k0ZstPuyqJiwYCpeIb1Hp_604g-TBXN2q5Exol1hRvsrE&m=HHRfndov7XBg2q2t6I4tqn3eGVK0G-47759ZoXrmneg&s=67Nwy0Qj168jZ-LlwcWeGzD79_9CU12ZpTza2I4JEws&e=

Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
TONIGHT: A Legendary Film and Soundtrack introduced by seven time-Academy Award-winning sound designer Gary Rydstrom!

The Elephant Man
(David Lynch, 1980, USA/UK, 35mm, 124 min)

In a career of defying expectations, David Lynch‚Äôs second feature remains an anomaly: a period biography in which the director‚Äôs hallmark strangeness comes from historical fact rather than his own imagination. It‚Äôs the story of John Merrick‚Äîthe genetically disfigured ‚ÄúElephant Man‚Äù‚Äîwho is rescued from a life as an exploited side-show attraction by a doctor who sees the humanity behind the deformities. Title: CALLING: Producers for This is a Test
Creator: Nathaniel Hoopes <nathanielhoopes2020@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
*THIS IS A TEST*
[image: maxresdefault (1).jpg]
*A Senior Directing Film*
*Written and Directed by Nat Hoopes*

*This could be his last chance to find it. What is it? What is it? This is
a test.*

*(Shooting 6th and 7th Weekends of Winter Quarter)*

Howdy. My name's Nat. I'm looking for producers for my senior directing
film, *This is a Test*. If you have any interest, please shoot me an email
at nathanielhoopes2020@u.northwestern.edu. I'm looking for people who are
passionate about the script and who have previous producing experience!
Most recent version of script is attached. Let's chat about it!

Title: Re: WRITER & DIRECTOR SPEED DATING this Wednesday!
Creator: Studio 22 Exec <studio22.exec@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
*This is happening tonight at 5!*

Here are a few things to come prepared with...

*Writers:* Please bring a hard copy of a draft or an in depth concept as
well as a logline.

*Directors:* Be prepared to talk about any past work and your directorial

Title: Weiko Lin Talk | Hollywood & China | 4:30pm Today
Creator: Patrick Lile <p-lile@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
INTERNATIONAL PASSPORT TO HOLLYWOOD AND CHINA with Screenwriter Weiko Lin - 4:30-5:45pm Tues. Oct. 8 - McCormick Foundation Forum
Chinese companies are investing billions of dollars in creative content domestically and in Hollywood. With the most cinema screens in the world, China's highest grossing local movie scored over $860 million and its first sci-fi movie reached almost $700 million. And recently, its own domestic animation film has crossed over $500 million. This conversation will explore what this means for filmmakers, writers, producers, executives, and actors working creatively with China as Hollywood evolves into global storytelling. In the midst of ever-changing [...]

The 2019-20 Applause for a Cause Feature Film Benefiting the Howard Area Community Center Written by Christian Ubillus Directed by Tony Inhorn and Shelby Schultz Produced by Grace Frome and Adam Present A young woman prepares a Thanksgiving dinner for a group of friends as a practice run before making actual Thanksgiving dinner for her family. Title: ANNOUNCING: CIFF Volunteer Training and Info Session
Creator: Studio 22 Exec <studio22.exec@GMAIL.COM>
Description:
Join Orli Spierer, NU RTVF alumna, and learn how you can volunteer at the Chicago International Film Festival!
Tomorrow @ 5:30pm

RSVP to the Facebook event here!

Having previously worked at Sundance and Tribeca, Orli is now the Volunteer Manager at CIFF, and will be hosting a discussion on volunteering at film festivals. Volunteering at CIFF is a fantastic opportunity to learn about the Chicago film community, network with other filmmakers, see how large film festivals function, and get to watch amazing films from around the world! We hope to see you there!

Title: Bridge Out's SMILE Show Promo Video
Creator: Daniel Bunning <danielbunning2019@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
RTVF students,

Bridge Out is looking for a motivated RTVF student to help direct and lead
a 1-3 minute commercial/ promo video for their spring fundraiser April 3rd.

The project is expected to be fast paced with much of the commitment
occurring over fall quarter. This video will primarily be provided to
corporate sponsors and is expected to be shown around campus, locally, and
to outside media outlets. *Budget is negotiable, and compensation will be
provided*. Examples of prior projects will be requested upon application.
To apply email helpthesmileproject@gmail.com with interest.

Title: Adaptation RTVF 360- a few open spots
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
RTVF Undergrads,

There are still spots left in the course below. Check it out.

Adaptation

RTVF 360

In this class, we will examine the rich and complicated relationship between source material and adaptation through researching and writing our own tv, film, or play adaptations. We will engage with contemporary adaptations of Shakespearean tragedy, nineteenth century realism, twentieth century short story, and twenty-first century memoir in order to immerse ourselves in the process of translating a work‚Äôs story, characters, theme, and/or style into a new medium. [...]

Title: ANNOUNCING: The 2019-2020 Applause Feature Film - "We‚Äôre the Marvels"
Creator: Applause For a Cause <applausenu@GMAIL.COM>
Description: APPLAUSE FOR A CAUSE IS PROUD TO ANNOUNCE... The 2019-2020 Applause for a Cause Feature Film: Written by Christian Ubillus Directed by Tony Inhorn and Shelby Schultz Produced by Grace Frome and Adam Present A young woman prepares a Thanksgiving dinner for a group of friends as a practice run before making actual Thanksgiving dinner for her family. As we see the prep, the dinner, and the aftermath, out of order, we start to see that she and her friends similarly struggle with feelings of over-reliance on others - a feeling that‚Äôs just waiting to burst. Shooting: Winter Quarter Weekends [...]

Title: EPICS Industry Connect Night | Film & TV Organizations
Creator: Patrick Lile <p-lile@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
EPICS Industry Connect Night | Film & TV Organizations
Tuesday, October 29th, 5:45-8:00pm
Guild Lounge, Scott Hall
Speed-networking event with professionals in the film and television industry. 3-4 students in 10-min. rounds with each professional to ask questions, gain advice, make connections.
Confirmed organizations: Illinois Film Office, Media Process Group, CIFF, Periscope Post & Audio, Chicago Film Office, Prote√° Films, Music Box Films, Paonessa Talent Agency, 2112, and CBS.
RSVP in SoConnect<https://candidate.gradleaders.com/NWComm/Candidates/Login.aspx?pid=3626&workshopID=94308>

[image: image.png]

Title: SENIOR DIRECTING PREMIERE
Creator: Linkon Pickus <linkonpickus2019@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
[image: 60337158_372972579985866_4118089788152610816_n.jpg]

What's good y'all. SENIOR DIRECTING PREMIERE IS HERE, and though the
@Studio22 would have you believe otherwise its happening THIS FRIDAY.

Now there are A LOT of premieres happening this week but this one is
special since EVERY SINGLE FILM SHOWING was made by someone who WILL NOT BE
HERE next year. It's been a wild ride but we truly hope y'all pull up and
share in the hard work everyone has put in to make this happen including
many of yourselves. [...]

Check out what's happening this week below, and come to Premiere on Saturday! *Studio 22 Premiere* Come support the student filmmakers of Northwestern University and see 11 films they have created this year! *6:00 PM-10:00PM on Saturday, June 8th* *Ryan Auditorium in Tech* *Doors open at 4:45 PM! There will be a red carpet for pictures and an intermission with food!* *Dress to Impress: *Formal Dresscode Tickets are *FREE* for NU students, faculty, [...]

Description:

kyle-henry@northwestern.edu for more info.

From: Holly Jean Allen <holly.allen@northwestern.edu>
Date: Wed, May 29, 2019 at 12:13 PM
Subject: Paid summer internship with Kyle Henry
To: ursa.nurtvf@gmail.com <ursa.nurtvf@gmail.com>

*Summer Research Assistant Internship*

Professor Kyle Henry is looking for an assistant this summer for 8-10 weeks
(10-12 hours per week at $12/hr.) on a personal essay documentary in
development tentatively entitled, *Trace of Life*. The film uses archival
footage, animation, and reenactments to construct the life of an ordinary
American woman, his mother Elaine Jeannette Henry, throughout the twentieth
[...]

Title: ANNOUNCING: The Diversity in RTVF Panel Discussion
Creator: Jerry Lee <jerrylee2021@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Come support Northwestern POC/Queer filmmakers, as we break down what it was like to write/direct a short from a minority standpoint, as well as reflect upon what that process was like through our respective RTVF grants.

Our intention with this discussion is to help empower younger aspiring filmmakers-of-color here in RTVF. We hope to come together as a community, and demonstrate that these issues continue to be relevant to us in an ever changing media landscape. [...]

Title: Reminder: Rachel DeWoskin Visit 5/28/2019
Creator: Shannon C Pritchard <shannon.pritchard@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Dear RTVF Students, Faculty, and Staff:

A reminder that Tuesday, May 28th the RTVF Department will host a reading/talk by visiting writer Rachel DeWoskin. No RSVP required. See attached flyer above and below.

DeWoskin is a novelist, poet, and screenwriter, and a Creative Writing Prof at UChicago. She is currently adapting her memoir, FOREIGN BABES IN BEIJING (about life as the unlikely star of a Chinese soap opera) as a TV series for BBC America, and her novel BANSHEE (about female rage in academia) as a feature film starring Ally Sheedy. She will be speaking on May 28 at 3pm [...]

Title: AfroFuturism Film Fest 5/29
Creator: Nelson Okunlola <nelsonokunlola2021@U.NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description: [image: AfroFuturism Film Fest.PNG] An event presented by Living In Color and Black Arts Initiative: This program of short award-winning films from Black World Cinema's AfroFuturism Film Competition showcases the creative visions of filmmakers whose work captures the spirit and energy of AfroFuturism. Black World Cinema defines Afrofuturism, as Black radical imagination, amplified and transformative, to the point it impinges itself into reality. The 120 minute program presented by our guest, Floyd Webb, will feature a brief introduction to the subject of AfroFuturism, 10 min including historical background, 90 minutes of films, and 20 min of post-film discussion. The films [...]

Title: Garbage in Louis Hall Editing Suites
Creator: Adam Stein <adam@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hello RTVF,

This is a reminder that you should not be leaving garbage or anything else in the editing suites when you leave. The editing suites are meant to be used by all, and leaving garbage and other things in them creates a poor environment for other students. Recently, Louis Hall staff have been finding more garbage in the suites such as water bottles, food wrappers, used straws and a variety of other thing that should be properly disposed of. Officially, there is no eating or drinking in any of the spaces in Louis Hall, and if this behavior continues [...]

Title: Rachel DeWoskin visit
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Dear RTVF Students, Faculty, and Staff:

Thursday, May 28th the RTVF Department will host a reading/talk by visiting writer Rachel DeWoskin. See attached flyer above and below.

DeWoskin is a novelist, poet, and screenwriter, and a Creative Writing Prof at UChicago. She is currently adapting her memoir, FOREIGN BABES IN BEIJING (about life as the unlikely star of a Chinese soap opera) as a TV series for BBC America, and her novel BANSHEE (about female rage in academia) as a feature film starring Ally Sheedy. She will be speaking on May 28 at 3pm in the AMS Auditorium to members [...]

Title: The Area @ Block Museum tonight, 7pm - Q&A moderated by MFA Doc student Naeema Torres
Creator: Patrick Lile <p-lile@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
The Area
Tonight, Thurs 5/16 @ 7pm, FREE
NU‚Äôs Block Museum of Art

The Area is a new documentary telling a story that‚Äôs well known to many. It follows the five-year odyssey of a South Side Chicago neighborhood, where more than 400 African-American families are being displaced by a multibillion-dollar freight company. The film is told through the perspective of its residents: homeowner-turned-activist Deborah Payne, who vows to be ‚Äúthe last house standing,‚Äù and the Row Row Boys, teen friends who must start a new life across gang lines. [...]

Title: URAP
Creator: Radio/TV/Film Department <rtf@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Dear Students,

The Undergraduate Research Assistant Program (URAP) is designed to help students of all disciplines get started in research! This program pairs students who are new to research with faculty mentors who are in need of assistance on their own research projects. In doing so, students who do not have sufficient research experience to design and carry out their own independent research project<https://undergradresearch.northwestern.edu/summerurg> gain mentoring and first-hand knowledge of research practices in their discipline. [...]

Title: Literary Management & Production Co. Summer internship
Creator: Laura Myers <laura-myers@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Literary management and production company, The Shuman Company, seeks intern for the Summer 2019 term, available to start ASAP. End date flexible. We are located in Culver City, CA. This is ideal for someone interested in film and TV development.

Description:
Hello RTVF students,

You're invited to a public reading of MFA in Writing for the Screen + Stage second-year Nikkita Duke's "Affiong's First Novel." Title: Louis Hall Data Management Reminder
Creator: Adam Stein <adam@NORTHWESTERN.EDU>
Description:
Hello RTVF,

As we head into the back half of the Spring Term, it‚Äôs important to take a second to practice good file management for your projects. Each one of computer boot drives in Louis Hall editing suites has a total of 512GB worth of space, and only about 300GB worth of space available once all the applications have been installed. When the boot drive reaches 80% or higher, the system performance is affected and the system will no longer operate the way we need it to. When it reaches 90% or higher, the machine can fail to boot or [...]
